Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who We Are




Geotab ® is a global leader in IoT and connected transportation and certified “Great Place to Work ™ .” We are a company of diverse and talented individuals who work together to help businesses grow and succeed, and increase the safety and sustainability of our communities.




Geotab is advancing security, connecting commercial vehicles to the internet and providing web-based analytics to help customers better manage their fleets. Geotab’s open platform and Geotab Marketplace ® , offering hundreds of third-party solution options, allows both small and large businesses to automate operations by integrating vehicle data with their other data assets. Processing billions of data points a day, Geotab leverages data analytics and machine learning to improve productivity, optimize fleets through the reduction of fuel consumption, enhance driver safety and achieve strong compliance to regulatory changes.




Our team is growing and we’re looking for people who follow their passion, think differently and want to make an impact. Ours is a fast paced, ever changing environment. Geotabbers accept that challenge and are willing to take on new tasks and activities - ones that may not always be described in the initial job description. Join us for a fulfilling career with opportunities to innovate, great benefits, and our fun and inclusive work culture. Reach your full potential with Geotab. To see what it’s like to be a Geotabber, check out our blog and follow us @InsideGeotab on Instagram . Join our talent network to learn more about job opportunities and company news.




Who You Are




We are always looking for amazing talent who can contribute to our growth and deliver results! Geotab is seeking a Data Scientist focused on working on the design and construction of Geotab's data mining and model building processes from vast amounts of raw data. This position collaborates with internal technical teams in analyzing trends to make improved decision-making in producing effective customer-facing products.




What You’ll Do




You will work with Geotab’s Data and Analytics team who is constantly producing deep analysis and insight into Geotab’s data infrastructure leveraging machine learning techniques. As a Data Scientist you will work on several projects related to g eo localization algorithms improvement.




How You’ll Make An Impact




Design and construct Geotab’s data modeling processes.
Create algorithms and predictive models to extract information required to solve complex business problems.
Generate queries from Geotab’s Big Data Infrastructure from Data Warehousing database (i.e. Google BigQuery).
Use Machine Learning (ML) packages (e.g. Scikit-learn and Tensorflow) to develop ML models and features.
Test the performance of data-driven products and make recommendations for improving Geotab’s product suite.
Collaborate with internal technical teams to gather requirements.
Responsible for the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, and dashboards to drive key business decisions.
Support a platform providing ad-hoc and automated access to large datasets.




What You’ll Bring To This Role




3-5 years experience as a Data Scientist or a similar role.
Great knowledge of programming languages such as Python and SQL.
Understanding of machine learning and operations research..
Thorough knowledge of Big Data tools and Data Mining/Warehousing Programs (e.g. Google BigQuery).
Experience with machine learning techniques (e.g. Scikit-learn, Tensorflow).
Experience using/building business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau) and data frameworks.
Experience working within a technical or engineering organization, with knowledge of the high-technology industry is an asset.
High accuracy and meticulous attention to detail.
High level of spoken English and Spanish.
Highly organized and able to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
Must stay relevant to technology and should have the flexibility to adapt to the growing technology and market demands.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to problem solve well-judged decisions.
Strong team-player with the ability to engage with all levels of the organization.
Technical competence using software programs, including but not limited to, Google Suite for business (Sheets, Docs, Slides).
Entrepreneurial mindset and comfortable in a flat organization.




If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this role! Even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply.




What makes our staff passionate about Geotab?




Work from home and flex working arrangements




Home office reimbursement program




Fantastic state of the art office




Public transportation reimbursement




Employer pension contributions




Generous medical & dental benefits offered to you and family members




Electric vehicle purchase incentive program




Subsidized fitness membership




Co-pay tuition reimbursement




The above are offered to full-time permanent employees only




How We Work




At Geotab, we have adopted a flexible first working model in that we have systems, functions, programs and policies in place to support both in-person and virtual work. However, you are welcomed and encouraged to come into our beautiful, safe, clean offices as often as you like. When working from home, you are required to have a reliable internet connection with at least 50mb DL/10mb UL. Virtual work is supported with cloud-based applications, collaboration tools and asynchronous working. The health and safety of employees are a top priority. We encourage work-life balance and keep the Geotab culture going strong with online social events, chat rooms and gatherings. Join us and help reshape the future of technology!




We believe that ensuring diversity is fundamental to our future growth and progress and is an integral part of our business. We believe that success happens where new ideas can flourish – in an environment that is rich in diversity and a place where people from various backgrounds can work together. Geotab encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to accommodating people with disabilities during the recruitment and assessment processes and when people are hired. We will ensure the accessibility needs of employees with disabilities are taken into account as part of performance management, career development, training and redeployment processes. If you require accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information about our diversity and inclusion as well as accommodation policies and practices, please contact us at careers@geotab.com. Click here to learn more about what happens with your personal data.

  • Experience with machine learning techniques (e.g. Scikit-learn, Tensorflow).
  • Experience using/building business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau) and data frameworks.
  • Experience working within a technical or engineering organization, with knowledge of the high-technology industry is an asset.
  • High accuracy and meticulous attention to detail.
  • High level of spoken English and Spanish.
  • Highly organized and able to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
  • Must stay relevant to technology and should have the flexibility to adapt to the growing technology and market demands.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to problem solve well-judged decisions.
  • Strong team-player with the ability to engage with all levels of the organization.
  • Technical competence using software programs, including but not limited to, Google Suite for business (Sheets, Docs, Slides).
  • Entrepreneurial mindset and comfortable in a flat organization.


If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this role! Even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply.


What makes our staff passionate about Geotab?


Work from home and flex working arrangements


Home office reimbursement program


Fantastic state of the art office


Public transportation reimbursement


Employer pension contributions


Generous medical & dental benefits offered to you and family members


Electric vehicle purchase incentive program


Subsidized fitness membership


Co-pay tuition reimbursement


  • The above are offered to full-time permanent employees only


How We Work


At Geotab, we have adopted a flexible first working model in that we have systems, functions, programs and policies in place to support both in-person and virtual work. However, you are welcomed and encouraged to come into our beautiful, safe, clean offices as often as you like. When working from home, you are required to have a reliable internet connection with at least 50mb DL/10mb UL. Virtual work is supported with cloud-based applications, collaboration tools and asynchronous working. The health and safety of employees are a top priority. We encourage work-life balance and keep the Geotab culture going strong with online social events, chat rooms and gatherings. Join us and help reshape the future of technology!


We believe that ensuring diversity is fundamental to our future growth and progress and is an integral part of our business. We believe that success happens where new ideas can flourish – in an environment that is rich in diversity and a place where people from various backgrounds can work together. Geotab encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to accommodating people with disabilities during the recruitment and assessment processes and when people are hired. We will ensure the accessibility needs of employees with disabilities are taken into account as part of performance management, career development, training and redeployment processes. If you require accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information about our diversity and inclusion as well as accommodation policies and practices, please contact us at careers@geotab.com. Click here to learn more about what happens with your personal data.

Title: Data Science Specialist
Description:
Plants of Tomorrow (PoT) is a strategic program from our Client multinantional swiss, having the goal to empower their business to increase productivity, reduce costs and get insights for new innovation by using Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning onsite and in real time.

Best of all, it enables their plants to leverage their existing systems to host both plant-specific as well as PoT new range of applications.




For this as part of the PoT ML-OPS team you’ll have the opportunity to manage the complex challenges of scale which are unique to

PoT, while using your expertise in coding, algorithms, complexity analysis and large-scale system design while keeping a results oriented approach.




PoT ML-OPS culture of diversity, intellectual curiosity, problem solving, and innovation oriented towards helping solving business problems and openness is key to its success. Our team brings together people with a wide variety of backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.

We encourage them to collaborate, think big and take risks in a blame-free environment.

We promote self-direction to work on meaningful projects, while we also strive to create an environment that provides the support and mentorship needed to learn and grow.




Key Responsibilities:

Drive autonomously multiple developments and/or deployments across various products to meet organization’s objectives.
Work with business stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
Develop, deploy and maintain custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize manufacturing processes, product quality and other business processes.
Develop testing framework and test model quality.
Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.




Key Values:

Self-driven, autonomous, results oriented person
Enjoys solving business and technical challenges
Positive and joyful attitude including under stress
Analytical and practical mindset
Curiosity to explore, to learn new things and to challenge existing understandings
Design solutions considering the context, the end result and all the intermediate elements
Build solutions to be reliable, secure, sustainable and performant while remaining pragmatic in achieving the intermediate objectives
Courage to take risks, openness to admit errors and move forward by learning from errors
Perseverance in face of setbacks




Key Skills:

Strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on product development.
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (time series, regression, classification, clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (forecasting, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
We’re looking for someone with 7-10 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical and machine learning models, has a Master’s or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field, and is familiar with the following software/tools:
Expertise in coding, algorithms, and proficiency in any of these programming languages: Python, R, Scala, C++.
Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets: SQL, Python, etc.
Experience using major cloud providers (for machine learning training / MLOps pipelines) like GCP, AWS, Azure, etc.
Experience using AutoML tools, such as: DataRobot, Vertex AI, etc.
Experience working in the MLOps setup, deploying and scaling multiple products.
Adequate expertise and experience in delivering solutions to production via Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD).
Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: time series, regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, anomaly detection, decision trees, neural networks, etc.
Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using: Google DataStudio, Tableau, Qlik, Plotly/ggplot/Matplotlib.
Advanced/bilingual English essential, the interviews will be conducted in this language, other languages such as French or German are valuable




Nice to have:

Experience with developing and deploying machine learning models for the heavy/process manufacturing industries like cement, steel, paper, oil, mining…
Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Gurobi, MySQL, etc.




We offer:

A professional career where you will set the limits, we will leave you and encourage you to grow
Gross remuneration to be negotiated based on the expertise provided, we will not rule out any professional if their assessment is justified.
100% teleworking and more social benefits that we will explain to you if you are our candidate.

Show more Show less

  • Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Gurobi, MySQL, etc.


We offer:

  • A professional career where you will set the limits, we will leave you and encourage you to grow

Title: EMEA Data Scientist- Remote (open to candidates across Europe)
Description:
What Is It Like To Work at Zimmer Biomet




At Zimmer Biomet, we believe in The Power of Us, which means that we are stronger together. We are committed to creating an environment where every team member feels included, respected, empowered, and celebrated.




Zimmer Biomet Offers You An Exciting Position With Good Career Prospects in a Fast-growing International Business, And a Competitive Remuneration Package




Possibility to grow, develop, and be promoted within a Team
Friendly, warm and creative atmosphere
Healthy, inspiring, and international work environment
Ongoing coaching and talent development
Access to future career opportunities
Hybrid work model
Competitive reward packages
Annual bonus
Social and CSR events
Wellbeing initiatives




What You Can Expect




As a market leader in the industry and in line with our strategic priorities, Zimmer Biomet is focused to become the partner of choice and set exceptional new standards in customer centricity with agile ways of working and innovative solutions to drive market share gain. The EMEA Marketing team is responsible for designing, developing and implementing the key pillars of this transformation. This team also leads and establishes the regional marketing strategy and provides market and portfolio insights to the rest of the organization, including our executive leadership.




As Data Scientist, you will contribute to the OC program office where you will be responsible for supporting usage, maintaining and improving the OC Scoring Engine, as well as adjusting and tuning the scoring engine for new markets and segments. In addition, you will provide support to the Marketing team in conception of other engine / Machine Learning (ML) initiatives as well as in the optimization of internal reports that feed our strategic operating mechanisms.




How You Create Impact




Execute engine (ML-algorithm) prediction weekly
Participate in and facilitate the feedback sessions with engine’s users
Process feedback from engine’s users and improve the engine based on this feedback
Integrate new data sources into the engine
Deploy the engine as a production ML-model
Calculate and track engine’s KPIs
Make data and logic adjustments to the Existing engine (ML-model) for new markets
Facilitate data collecting and cleaning process for new markets (work with Data Engineer)
Participate in and facilitate the feedback sessions with engine’s users
Support the Marketing team in the design of other ML models with different applications (e.g. Competitive Intelligence)
Help build and optimize market and sales reports used for ongoing business reviews




What Will Make You Stand Out




Educated to University Level. Graduate with a Bachelor’s Degree
Fluent English and one other European languages will be a plus




What Will Make You Successful




3+ years of work experience
Experience in building and deploying ML-models
Programming languages skills: python, SQL
Proficient in ML-related libraries: sklearn, pandas, numpy, shap
Experience is using Azure infrastructure is not obligatory but appreciated
High interest and passion for data analysis and performance tracking/ consulting
Analytical ability to gather data, perform complex analysis and to solve both business and technical problems
Agility and initiative to react quickly to new opportunities
Able to build credibility quickly with people at all levels of the organization
Fast learner, can work independently and manage complex projects
Strong communication and presentation skills
Ability to work with diverse, cross-regional teams in a matrix organization




Who We Are




Zimmer Biomet is a world leader in musculoskeletal health solutions. Our team members are part of a company with a heritage of leadership, a focus on shaping the future, and a mission dedicated to alleviating pain and improving the quality of life for people around the world.




Looking to make an impact? Join us and make a difference.




Learn more about us by visiting zimmerbiomet.com
Show more Show less

Title: Business Data Scientist
Description:
¿Quieres formar parte de una compañía especializada 100% en proyectos propios de#Data & #Analytics? Sí es así, ¡Sigue leyendo! 👀




Aunque somos poco conocidos entre el gran público, en SDG trabajamos para la mitad de grupos del IBEX-35 y en multitud de empresas internacionales. Gracias al boom de la analítica, estamos en un ritmo constante de crecimiento y desde 1994 ayudamos a nuestros clientes a entender y analizar sus datos.







¿Cuál será tu misión?✍




Ayudarás a los equipos de negocio a sacar más valor a los datos, identificando qué problemas existen y cómo pueden mejorar su negocio




¿Cómo lo harás?

Desde la definición del proceso de negocio y la búsqueda de soluciones que permitan sacar el mayor partido a los datos.
Liderando pruebas de concepto para demostrar el funcionamiento de las soluciones recomendadas.
Realizando análisis de datos complejos para dar recomendaciones de negocio claras
Acompañarás en todo el proceso para otorgar las mejores soluciones.




¿Qué te hará triunfar en esta posición?👇




Estudios de ingeniería Industrial, Telecos..
Que cuentes con conocimientos y experiencia en proyectos usando Python y SQL
Que tengas una clara vocación por analítica de datos y orientación a negocio, una de tus funciones principales será entender todo su contexto y ayudar a la toma de decisiones.
Experiencia trabajando con datos ya que será tu día a día y la base de todo tu trabajo.
Que seas un apasionado y quieras seguir desarrollando tu carrera profesional en torno a la consultoría de negocio.
Buenas habilidades comunicativas ya que estarás involucrado en la parte funcional y en el trato con cliente.
Contar con mentalidad problem-solving ya que te enfrentarás a entornos cambiantes.
Cómo trabajamos en un entorno global, ¡será un plus que puedas comunicarte en inglés!




¿Qué nos hace diferentes? 🧐




En nuestros proyectos, los datos y la tecnología son los protagonistas, te formaremos para que puedas trabajar con lo último del mercado (tenemos un área de innovación dónde impulsamos nuevos partnerships con fabricantes tecnológicos y centros de I+D).




Tendrás todas las oportunidades para alcanzar tu mejor versión, con un plan de carrera totalmente personalizado en el que aprenderás por ti mismo y además, contarás con el apoyo del resto de compañerxs.




Tu mismo te marcarás tus propios tiempos, semestralmente hablarás con tu responsable para compartir feedback y nuevos retos, y en base a tus resultados, habrá una revisión salarial.

Somos una gran familia, desde el minuto 1 trataremos de hacerte la vida más fácil. Tanto tus compañerxs como el resto de equipo siempre tendrán una sonrisa y estarán dispuestos a ayudarte y ofrecerte todo su apoyo.




Colaborarás y trabajarás en tu día a día con grandes referentes (técnicos y/o de negocio), estarán encantados de enseñarte todo lo posible y se sentirán orgullosxs de verte crecer.




Con nosotros el Smartwork es posible. Vivirás una forma de trabajo en la que cada uno gestiona su propio tiempo. ¿Quieres trabajar 100% en remoto?¿Quieres un modelo híbrido?

En SDG podrás elegir cómo quieres trabajar, aunque creemos que es importante ponernos cara más allá de la pantalla ¡Te esperaremos en los Afterworks!




Somos una marca con propósito. Creemos que la diversidad y la inclusión ayudan a promover una cultura de creatividad, permitiéndonos superar nuevas situaciones y desafíos.




Metiéndonos un poco más en temas más formales, pero no menos importantes, ofrecemos contrato indefinido, ¡queremos que te quedes con nosotrxs mucho tiempo!, salario competitivo de acuerdo con tú nivel de formación y experiencia (no te preocupes, ya qué, en la primera entrevista, trataremos este aspecto y te informaremos si tus expectativas están alineadas) y te ofrecemos una ayuda económica para gastos ocasionados por el teletrabajo.




Podríamos continuar detallando que nos hace especiales, y nos encantará hacerlo en todas las fases de entrevistas. ✌️







Por último, queremos contarte los pasos de nuestro proceso de selección




En nuestros procesos realizarás 3️ sesiones:

Primera toma de contacto con nuestra área de People First (donde trataremos temas de crecimiento profesional, banda salarial y definiremos qué áreas se adaptan a ti).
Segunda sesión técnica donde podrás sorprendernos con todos tus conocimientos y habilidades en entornos tecnológicos (y así poder ofrecerte un proyecto que encaje con tus conocimientos e intereses).
Reunión con el responsable del equipo en el que te incorporarías para poder solucionar todas las dudas que te hayan podido surgir en el proceso.




¿Has superado todas las fases? ¡Buenas noticias! Recibirás una llamada de People First donde te presentaremos nuestra propuesta para que te unas a nosotrxs, y poder resolverte cualquier duda que tengas al respecto. Cuando nos confirmes que quieres formar parte de la familia SDG, empezaremos a preparar todo para recibirte con mucha ilusión.




¿No te puedes incorporar ahora, pero tienes curiosidad e interés en SDG Group? No te preocupes, puedes realizar ahora el proceso de selección y te tendremos en cuenta en las próximas vacantes que encajen con tu perfil profesional.







INSCRÍBETE AHORA ¡ESTAMOS DESEANDO CONOCERTE!

Show more Show less

Con nosotros el Smartwork es posible. Vivirás una forma de trabajo en la que cada uno gestiona su propio tiempo. ¿Quieres trabajar 100% en remoto?¿Quieres un modelo híbrido?

En SDG podrás elegir cómo quieres trabajar, aunque creemos que es importante ponernos cara más allá de la pantalla ¡Te esperaremos en los Afterworks!


Somos una marca con propósito. Creemos que la diversidad y la inclusión ayudan a promover una cultura de creatividad, permitiéndonos superar nuevas situaciones y desafíos.


Metiéndonos un poco más en temas más formales, pero no menos importantes, ofrecemos contrato indefinido, ¡queremos que te quedes con nosotrxs mucho tiempo!, salario competitivo de acuerdo con tú nivel de formación y experiencia (no te preocupes, ya qué, en la primera entrevista, trataremos este aspecto y te informaremos si tus expectativas están alineadas) y te ofrecemos una ayuda económica para gastos ocasionados por el teletrabajo.


Podríamos continuar detallando que nos hace especiales, y nos encantará hacerlo en todas las fases de entrevistas. ✌️



Por último, queremos contarte los pasos de nuestro proceso de selección


En nuestros procesos realizarás 3️ sesiones:

  • Primera toma de contacto con nuestra área de People First (donde trataremos temas de crecimiento profesional, banda salarial y definiremos qué áreas se adaptan a ti).
  • Segunda sesión técnica donde podrás sorprendernos con todos tus conocimientos y habilidades en entornos tecnológicos (y así poder ofrecerte un proyecto que encaje con tus conocimientos e intereses).
  • Reunión con el responsable del equipo en el que te incorporarías para poder solucionar todas las dudas que te hayan podido surgir en el proceso.


¿Has superado todas las fases? ¡Buenas noticias! Recibirás una llamada de People First donde te presentaremos nuestra propuesta para que te unas a nosotrxs, y poder resolverte cualquier duda que tengas al respecto. Cuando nos confirmes que quieres formar parte de la familia SDG, empezaremos a preparar todo para recibirte con mucha ilusión.


¿No te puedes incorporar ahora, pero tienes curiosidad e interés en SDG Group? No te preocupes, puedes realizar ahora el proceso de selección y te tendremos en cuenta en las próximas vacantes que encajen con tu perfil profesional.



INSCRÍBETE AHORA ¡ESTAMOS DESEANDO CONOCERTE!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The ideal candidate's favorite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers. 

 

Responsibilities
Analyze raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, structuring for downstream processing
Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
Collaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
Generate actionable insights for business improvements




Qualifications

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
At least 1 - 2 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modeling
Deep understanding of predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
Fluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau)

Show more Show less

The ideal candidate's favorite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers. 

 

Responsibilities
  • Analyze raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, structuring for downstream processing
  • Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
  • Collaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
  • Generate actionable insights for business improvements


Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
  • At least 1 - 2 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modeling
  • Deep understanding of predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
  • Fluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)
  • Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Estamos buscando un Data Scientist para un proyecto innovador y apasionante. El cliente es una compañía que ofrece servicios de consultoría de tecnologías de la información, desarrollo e integración de soluciones informáticas y outsourcing de procesos de negocio.




Desarrollamos nuestra actividad en grandes cuentas de los sectores de Telecomunicaciones, Seguros, Entidades Financieras, Administraciones Públicas, Industria y Utilities.




Requisitos:




Formación técnica superior.




Perfil analítico, con experiencia en CRM, Data Analytics, Customer Intelligence o BI.




Experiencia en reporting.




Conocimiento medio/alto de Base de datos.




Experiencia en gestión de bases de datos, generación de consultas, desarrollo de procesos automáticos y conocimientos de infraestructura.




Amplio conocimiento con herramientas de análisis de datos (Python, R, ...).




Funciones a realizar




Analizar, interpretar y extraer conclusiones en base a datos de negocio.




Elaboración de informes estratégicos para la toma de decisiones.




Razonamiento de resultados en base a los resultados obtenidos en los análisis.




Desarrollo de recomendaciones concretas para la mejora del negocio.




Control de calidad de las bases de datos y análisis realizados




Ofrecemos:




Contrato indefinido




Horario de oficina.




80% teletrabajo.

Title: Data Scientist / Deep Learning Engineer
Description:
The Role

As Data Scientist / Deep Learning Engineer in the VI (Visual Intelligence) Core Team, you will contribute to a largely self-sufficient team that develops, delivers, runs, maintains and evolves innovative machine learning powered services that provide significant value to Solera’s customers.

Visual Intelligence (VI) is Solera’s market-leading automated damage detection solution driven by state-of-the-art computer vision technology. The VI Core Team is the self-sufficient team that owns the AI technology behind VI and exposes it to its clients via a RESTful API. In addition to VI the team owns and develops ML components for other Solera products such as an invoice checking solution for the property claims space.

What You’ll Do

First Month

Get familiar with our tooling and infrastructure, our portfolio and components, the data, and the team
Run some of our services end-to-end
Make your first PR
Start contributing your ideas on all levels (data, models, code, team, etc.)


First few Months

Work on our DS components, reproducing results, understanding challenges, contributing code, and planning improvements towards our team's objectives
Synchronously and asynchronously communicate your ideas to your peers, build consensus and document progress, discussions, and decisions
Conduct experiments towards a desired outcome using a hypothesis-driven approach
Collaborate with the team to make decisions around practices and tooling and to drive the continuous improvement of the team's ability to deliver outcomes


After Onboarding

Take full ownership of one or more data science components that the team owns
Innovate through research and experimentation with new tools, methods and technology
Propose radical ideas around existing products as well as new product ideas
Dedicate part of your work time to making progress towards your personal learning objectives


What You’ll Bring
Degree in a quantitative discipline
Deep understanding of and proven ability to apply data science and machine learning concepts such as deep learning, CNN (in particular computer vision), instance segmentation, boosting, statistical analysis, predictive modelling, time series and temporal data
Demonstrated proficiency in Python and the Python data science ecosystem (SciPy, NumPy, pandas, seaborn, Matplotlib, Dask, …). Additional proficiency in second language would be a plus
Experience with data analysis and evaluation (in particular image data), to create curated and efficient datasets
Experience with image augmentation and preprocessing techniques (using PIL, OpenCV and albumentations)
Proficiency either PyTorch or TensorFlow, OpenCV, and SQL
Familiarity with any of the following would be a plus or desirable:
Google Cloud Platform (particularly Big Query, Vertex AI, Dataflow)
Kubernetes, Apache Beam
ML Operations (CD4ML)
3D graphics and synthetic training data
Concepts such as photogrammetry, vision transformers, structure from motion
NLP

Soft Skills

Proficiency in the English language (spoken and written) to be able to be successful with a globally distributed team and stakeholders
Demonstrated capacity to clearly and concisely communicate complex technical and scientific ideas and concepts
Demonstrated ability to take full ownership of your work and deliver outcomes inline with given objectives
Demonstrated ability to collaborate, hold yourself and others accountable, contribute to the advancement of the team on multiple levels and outside of primary responsibilities if necessary
Strong tendency towards communication, transparency and inclusion
Strong drive to shape the culture and practices of the team and commitment to continuous improvement of the team.
Show more Show less

Title: Data Scientist Senior Industria y Energía
Description:
NTT Data somos todas las personas que la formamos. Un equipo de más de 139.000 profesionales, tan diverso cómo diversos son los 50 países en los que estamos presentes y los diferentes sectores en los que desarrollamos nuestra actividad; telecomunicaciones, entidades financieras, industria, utilities, energía, administración pública y sanidad.




¿Nuestra misión? Ofrecer soluciones tecnológicas, de negocio, estrategia, desarrollo y mantenimiento de aplicaciones, siendo un referente en consultoria. Todo gracias a la colaboración entre equipos, la calidad humana de nuestra gente y a que no nos conformamos con lo establecido, buscamos siempre la innovación que nos acerca al futuro.




Nuestra esencia nos ha llevado a la vanguardia de la tecnología, a romper paradigmas y a brindar las soluciones que realmente se corresponden a las necesidades de cada cliente. Nuestro talento nos ha hecho poder decir con orgullo que somos una de las 6 empresas TOP de tecnologías en el mundo.




Porque #Greattech, needs #GreatPeople, like you.




NTT DATA desea contratar consultores senior de proyectos analíticos para el departamento de Business Analytics que sean capaces de obtener conclusiones de negocio a partir de grandes volúmenes de información mediante la realización de análisis estadísticos y modelos de data science. Es necesario tener experiencia probada en sector Industria, Utilities o Oil&Gas.




Titulación: Formación en Matemáticas, Estadística o formación técnica (Ingeniería Informática, Ingeniería Industrial, Ingeniería Telecomunicaciones…). Se valorarán Posgrados en Inteligencia Artificial, Data Science, Analytics, Big Data o similar.







Experiencia: +3 años en Business Analytics o Data Science vinculado a Industria, Utilities, Energía, Oil&Gas.




Tareas a realizar:

Toma de requerimientos de usuarios de negocio, entendimiento del valor añadido e incorporación de ello en el diseño de los modelos.
Análisis de fuentes de información con las áreas de tecnología.
Elaboración de estudios y análisis del negocio orientados a la obtención de conclusiones de negocio.
Análisis de datos mediante estadística descriptiva y exploratoria.
Análisis teórico/práctico con técnicas Matemáticas, Machine Learning e IA para predicción y optimización y su posterior aplicación a la resolución de problemas reales.
Desarrollo de nuevos algoritmos que permitan alcanzar los objetivos y mejorar los resultados existentes, aplicando técnicas de modelación y Machine Learning.
Gestión de proyectos y coordinación de un equipo de 2-3 personas.
Gestión y relación con el cliente.
Gestión de las relaciones multidisciplinares: de negocio y tecnología.







Conocimientos:




Requerido:

Estadística descriptiva y exploratoria
Conocimiento experto de al menos un lenguaje estadístico: Python o R
SQL y BBDD relacional y no relacional
Técnicas de Machine Learning y Advanced Analytics: redes neuronales, Random Forest, SVM, algoritmos evolutivos, series temporales, modelos y redes bayesianas, segmentación, etc.
Gestión (y metodologías de gestión) de proyecto y equipos
Visualización y comunicación a clientes, incluyendo uso de Power Point, Excel u otras herramientas como PowerBI, Tableau, etc.




Valorado:

Tecnologías Big Data: Spark, Hadoop, Impala, etc.
Conocimiento y uso de plataformas y servicios analíticos cloud: AWS, Azure Microsoft, Google Cloud.
SAS
Text Analytics, Deep Learning, Process Mining




Especializaciones deseadas en Industria:

Gran Consumo
Retail
HTTL
Transporte y logística
Auto




Especializaciones deseadas en Energía, Utilities y Oil&Gas:

Generación de energía
Transporte de la energía
Distribución de la energía
Comercialización de energía
Gestión de la energía
Gestión de activos e infraestructura
Upstream, midstream, downstream




En NTT Data creemos que toda persona es única y diferente y por ello apostamos por una cultura inclusiva que reconoce y valora la diversidad.




Trabajamos día a día para crear un entorno en el que podamos explorar, vivir y potenciar nuestra propia singularidad.

#WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique

Show more Show less

NTT Data somos todas las personas que la formamos. Un equipo de más de 139.000 profesionales, tan diverso cómo diversos son los 50 países en los que estamos presentes y los diferentes sectores en los que desarrollamos nuestra actividad; telecomunicaciones, entidades financieras, industria, utilities, energía, administración pública y sanidad.

  • Análisis de fuentes de información con las áreas de tecnología.
  • Elaboración de estudios y análisis del negocio orientados a la obtención de conclusiones de negocio.
  • Análisis de datos mediante estadística descriptiva y exploratoria.
  • Análisis teórico/práctico con técnicas Matemáticas, Machine Learning e IA para predicción y optimización y su posterior aplicación a la resolución de problemas reales.
  • Desarrollo de nuevos algoritmos que permitan alcanzar los objetivos y mejorar los resultados existentes, aplicando técnicas de modelación y Machine Learning.

  • Conocimiento experto de al menos un lenguaje estadístico: Python o R
  • SQL y BBDD relacional y no relacional

  • Gestión (y metodologías de gestión) de proyecto y equipos
  • Visualización y comunicación a clientes, incluyendo uso de Power Point, Excel u otras herramientas como PowerBI, Tableau, etc.


Valorado:

  • Tecnologías Big Data: Spark, Hadoop, Impala, etc.
  • Conocimiento y uso de plataformas y servicios analíticos cloud: AWS, Azure Microsoft, Google Cloud.
  • SAS
  • Text Analytics, Deep Learning, Process Mining


Especializaciones deseadas en Industria:

  • Gran Consumo
  • Retail
  • HTTL
  • Transporte y logística
  • Auto


Especializaciones deseadas en Energía, Utilities y Oil&Gas:

  • Generación de energía
  • Transporte de la energía
  • Distribución de la energía
  • Comercialización de energía
  • Gestión de la energía
  • Gestión de activos e infraestructura
  • Upstream, midstream, downstream


En NTT Data creemos que toda persona es única y diferente y por ello apostamos por una cultura inclusiva que reconoce y valora la diversidad.


Trabajamos día a día para crear un entorno en el que podamos explorar, vivir y potenciar nuestra propia singularidad.

#WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique

Title: Senior Data Scientist: NLP
Description:
This position can be based in London or Madrid. Remote options are available as well across the EU.

At Clarity AI, we are committed to bringing social impact to markets. We are a tech company started in 2017, leveraging AI and machine learning technologies to ensure environmental, social and governance dimensions are the focal point of decision making within financial markets.

We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as BlackRock, Deutsche Börse and Softbank who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!

What are we looking for?

We like data scientists that work with data in a scientific way and that share our passion for bringing social impact to the markets and making a difference. At Clarity you will help develop the “gold standard” to quantify social impact that will be used by investors, consumers and governments:

Use state of the art NLP tools, including the latest large language models, to efficiently extract, classify, and generate sustainability information
Working side-by-side with a top-talent team from business and academia.


Requirements

As the ideal candidate for the position:
>4 years of working experience as a Data Scientist, 2 years experience with NLP
You excel at problem solving:
Clarifying the nature of a problem and formulating relevant questions.
Breaking down a problem into smaller, more manageable parts, creating business value every step of the way.
Deciding among possible solutions in a critical way.
Implementing actions and evaluating outcomes in a quantitative way.
You have strong communication skills. The right candidate can thrive in an environment of asynchronous conversation, since a part of the Clarity team is based outside Europe. We expect you to have strong communication skills and be able to create working relationships with coworkers across various locations.
You possess and know how to share technical expertise:
Practitioner of modern NLP tools and techniques for classification, extraction, summarization, regression etc
Proficiency in standard tools
Preferred Python and its data science ecosystem (spacy, nltk, Hugging Face, OpenAI, etc).
SQL and noSQL databases
and techniques:
Data processing and cleaning
Working with limited labeled data and humans in the loop
Fine tuning and stacking of models
Regression, classification, clustering and other standard algorithms.
Bonus points if you have experience in
Deploying big data technologies like Spark or Dask
Using pipeline orchestration tools like Airflow
Work experience in a software company / using software best practices in your day-to-day work
You have a start-up way of working:
Self-motivation and drive to succeed.
Getting-the-job-done mentality.
Learn by doing, all the time.
Authorized to work in Europe / UK


Responsibilities of the role include

You are expected to expand the technical expertise of our current NLP team. You will share that expertise by both providing technical guidance to the team and mentoring junior members.
Day-to-day, you will have freedom to research, design, validate, and deploy NLP models to improve our current NLP systems.


Benefits

WHAT WE OFFER:


People are one of Clarity’s main assets. We have built a unique team and we all share 3 differential aspects: Excellence, Passion and Values.

The team comprises professionals from leading consulting and banking firms, MBA graduates from top business schools, entrepreneurs and researchers and PhDs.
Clarity’s Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognized as one of the most distinguished leaders under the age of 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum.


We are different. We work hard to become the best place to work and pride ourselves on our culture:

Fact based: Promoting objective, fact-based and solution-oriented discussions.
Diverse: Encouraging diversity of personalities, cultures and experiences.
Transparent: Communicating feedback transparently, constructively and in real-time.
Meritocratic: Striving for excellence and rewarding the best.
Flexible: Working flexibly in the broadest sense (schedule, location, vacation, styles).


Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. Thats why we created our own ERG groups.

Our own ERG groups act as a voluntary employee resource group, they commit to promoting these values and creating a safe and supportive community for all employees. They are committed to creating a workplace that champions sustainability, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI).

To do this, they will advocate for sustainability initiatives, host and participate in events, workshops, provide a safe space for employees to share their experiences, ideas, and solutions, and collaborate with other departments and employee groups to improve the company's sustainability goals.

By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.

We care about our employees. We think that every effort has to be rewarded and want them to feel comfortable with us.

ESOP/ Phantom stock: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity. That’s why we give them the opportunity to participate in our success with ESOP or phantom stock options.
Training budget: Continued learning is important to us so we provide everyone with a yearly training budget.
Amazing office in Madrid: We are located at Paseo de la Castellana 43 28046 Madrid Floors 5th and 6th floors.


We are a US company with a Spanish and London subsidiary. We have offices in NY, London, Abu Dhabi and Madrid, and a remote culture.

Our investors believe in us and share our goals. We are a leading startup thanks to public and private funding.

Clarity has received several awards:

Young Global Leader to Rebeca Minguela 2017.
Top 10 Fintech startup worldwide by BBVA Open Talent.
Top 2 start-ups with impact worldwide by IMPACT Growth 2017.
One of the most innovative Spanish companies by NeoTec.
One of the most innovative projects in the US. Harvard Innovation Lab.
Show more Show less

    • Implementing actions and evaluating outcomes in a quantitative way.
  • You have strong communication skills. The right candidate can thrive in an environment of asynchronous conversation, since a part of the Clarity team is based outside Europe. We expect you to have strong communication skills and be able to create working relationships with coworkers across various locations.
  • You possess and know how to share technical expertise:
    • Practitioner of modern NLP tools and techniques for classification, extraction, summarization, regression etc
    • Proficiency in standard tools
      • Preferred Python and its data science ecosystem (spacy, nltk, Hugging Face, OpenAI, etc).
      • SQL and noSQL databases
    • and techniques:
      • Data processing and cleaning
      • Working with limited labeled data and humans in the loop
      • Fine tuning and stacking of models
      • Regression, classification, clustering and other standard algorithms.
    • Bonus points if you have experience in
      • Deploying big data technologies like Spark or Dask
      • Using pipeline orchestration tools like Airflow
      • Work experience in a software company / using software best practices in your day-to-day work
  • You have a start-up way of working:
    • Self-motivation and drive to succeed.
    • Getting-the-job-done mentality.
    • Learn by doing, all the time.
  • Authorized to work in Europe / UK

Responsibilities of the role include
  • You are expected to expand the technical expertise of our current NLP team. You will share that expertise by both providing technical guidance to the team and mentoring junior members.
  • Day-to-day, you will have freedom to research, design, validate, and deploy NLP models to improve our current NLP systems.

Benefits
  • WHAT WE OFFER:

People are one of Clarity’s main assets. We have built a unique team and we all share 3 differential aspects: Excellence, Passion and Values.
  • The team comprises professionals from leading consulting and banking firms, MBA graduates from top business schools, entrepreneurs and researchers and PhDs.
  • Clarity’s Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognized as one of the most distinguished leaders under the age of 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum.

We are different. We work hard to become the best place to work and pride ourselves on our culture:
  • Fact based: Promoting objective, fact-based and solution-oriented discussions.
  • Diverse: Encouraging diversity of personalities, cultures and experiences.
  • Transparent: Communicating feedback transparently, constructively and in real-time.
  • Meritocratic: Striving for excellence and rewarding the best.
  • Flexible: Working flexibly in the broadest sense (schedule, location, vacation, styles).

Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. Thats why we created our own ERG groups.

Our own ERG groups act as a voluntary employee resource group, they commit to promoting these values and creating a safe and supportive community for all employees. They are committed to creating a workplace that champions sustainability, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI).

To do this, they will advocate for sustainability initiatives, host and participate in events, workshops, provide a safe space for employees to share their experiences, ideas, and solutions, and collaborate with other departments and employee groups to improve the company's sustainability goals.

By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.

We care about our employees. We think that every effort has to be rewarded and want them to feel comfortable with us.
  • ESOP/ Phantom stock: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity. That’s why we give them the opportunity to participate in our success with ESOP or phantom stock options.
  • Training budget: Continued learning is important to us so we provide everyone with a yearly training budget.
  • Amazing office in Madrid: We are located at Paseo de la Castellana 43 28046 Madrid Floors 5th and 6th floors.

We are a US company with a Spanish and London subsidiary. We have offices in NY, London, Abu Dhabi and Madrid, and a remote culture.

Our investors believe in us and share our goals. We are a leading startup thanks to public and private funding.

Clarity has received several awards:
  • Young Global Leader to Rebeca Minguela 2017.
  • Top 10 Fintech startup worldwide by BBVA Open Talent.
  • Top 2 start-ups with impact worldwide by IMPACT Growth 2017.
  • One of the most innovative Spanish companies by NeoTec.
  • One of the most innovative projects in the US. Harvard Innovation Lab.

Title: Modelling & Data Scientist
Description:
Job Title:

Modelling & Data Scientist

Job Description:

Funciones:

El candidato seleccionado formará parte del equipo de Modelling & Data Science en Dentsu participando en diferentes proyectos de análisis de datos, modelización y elaboración de recomendaciones a nuestros clientes. Será responsable de:

La elaboración de modelos matemáticos para medir, predecir y simular el efecto de la comunicación en los KPIs de negocio de los anunciantes.
Medición del impacto publicitario en los principales KPIs de los anunciantes y extracción de los principales aprendizajes mediante modelos de atribución multimedia y Marketing Mix Modelling.
Colaborar en el diseño y desarrollo de herramientas de análisis propias.
La elaboración de dashboard y cuadros de mando que permitan visualizar la evolución de los principales KPI de nuestros anunciantes.
Presentación de los resultados y aprendizajes obtenidos a los anunciantes para maximizar los resultados de las marcas.
Desarrollo técnico de nuevos productos y servicios que aporten valor añadido a los anunciantes.


Experiencia, aptitudes y conocimientos a valorar positivamente:

Participación en proyectos de I+D+I en los que se utilicen técnicas de modelización y machine learning.
Participación en proyectos relacionados con Investigación de mercado.
Experiencia en el sector de Marketing y Publicidad. En particular, en medición del impacto publicitario utilizando modelos matemáticos.
Experiencia en entornos de CRM y Marketing.
Capacidad de análisis y síntesis.
Facilidad para trabajar en equipo.
Proactividad, agilidad y compromiso.
Orientación al cliente y a la obtención de resultados.
Alta capacidad de comunicación.


Requerimientos:

Formación académica deseable: Doble grado matemáticas e ingeniería informática, licenciatura en Matemáticas o grado y/o máster en Ingeniería Matemática.
Experiencia mínima de 3-4 años en consultoría, Institutos de Investigación, agencias de medios o departamentos de Business Intelligence en áreas de modelización.
Nivel Alto de inglés (relación con clientes internacionales). Comunicación fluida en inglés, tanto en conversación como escrita.
Conocimiento de los lenguajes de programación R y Python.
Conocimientos de BBDD relacionales, PostgreSQL y MySQL además del lenguaje SQL.
Conocimientos de los principales servicios de Google Cloud Platform, Cloud SQL, Cloud Storage, BigQuery y Data Studio.
Conocimientos de PowerBI.
Nivel muy alto de Excel.
Disponibilidad para viajar.


Location:

Madrid

Brand:

Ymedia

Time Type:

Full time

Contract Type:

Permanent

Title: Data Scientist - AI
Place: Pozuelo de Alarcón, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Menhir Financial is a company that applies Artificial Intelligence to optimize processes and improve results, mainly focused on the banking sector.

We are building the next generation of technology for the management of NPL (non-Performing Loan) portfolios by combining machine learning models that already manage more than 800 million euros in loans. We work with first-level financial institutions.

We are looking for a Data Scientist eager to participate in the entire process of an Artificial Intelligence project: data analysis, cleaning, preprocessing, model development, hyperparameter optimization, backtesting and deployment.

You will face challenges to be solved and will have a deep impact on the final product. You will work in an agile environment, with incredible engineers who believe in our mission. We are looking for a data enthusiast who enjoys learning and building.

Tasks

🚀 The job:

You will develop and deploy new AI models, which will be used to analyze portfolios, predict behavior results, decipher the marketing mix and increase business opportunities for our clients
You will analyze data, obtaining graphs and relevant conclusions
You will generate measurable impact in international companies
We make technical decisions as a team, listening to each other to come up with good ideas.
We know that talent attracts talent. We would love for you to help bring in the people you liked working with the most.


Requirements

🧠 Requirements:

+1 year of experience as a Data Scientist
Degree in Computer Engineering, Telecommunications, Mathematics or any other engineering
Ability to analyze data in Python, obtain graphics and draw conclusions
Ability to develop AI models in Python, knowledge of frameworks and advanced algorithms
Knowledge of DB: SQL
Knowledge of Git for version control and teamwork
English


We value:

Experience in Cloud
Knowledge of CI / CD, construction and deployment tools (for example, Jenkins, Github Actions) and monitoring systems
Experience with Docker, Kubernetes or containers in general
Knowledge of DB: NoSQL
Being familiar with financial platforms and investment jargon (ROI stands for Return On Investment)
Having worked in fast-paced startup environments
Other languages


Benefits

📊 Benefits:

Competitive salary
Stock options
Flexible schedule: we care that you can reconcile your work life with your personal life
The work model is semi-presential, combining teleworking and presence
Health insurance fully covered by Menhir
Young environment


We are a team of data enthusiasts with a strong will to improve the established by means of AI. Do you want to be part of the Menhir ecosystem?
Show more Show less

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The Role

On this position, you will be required to have:

Strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on product development.
Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
Experience working with and creating data architectures.
Strong communication skills to lead and participate in global meetings.
Strong time management and organizational skills. Must be able to work under time pressure
Self-sufficient on problem solving
Ability to explain complex technical issues in a way that non-technical people may understand
Fluent English on business level (written and spoken)


What You’ll Do

Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
Collect structured and unstructured data.
Build predictive models and machine learning algorithms.
Promote machine learning processes to production to enrich existing datasets.
Enhance current data collection process with machine learning algorithm outputs.
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes.
Develop end to end prototypes for internal and external customers
Communicate and share projects within the team and the company
Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.


What You’ll Bring

Bachelor’s degree in computer science or numerate discipline
Deep experience (more than 5 years) manipulating data sets and building statistical models.
Deep experience (more than 5 years) building Machine Learning models and promoting them into production
Coding experience with Python or similar
Experience with visualizing data with tools like Jupiter notebooks
Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.
Some experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, etc.
Some containers deployment experience (Docker, Kubernetes…)
Some experience using web services: REST
Some experience analyzing data from 3rd party providers: Google Analytics, Facebook Insights, etc.
Strong with agile development concept and experience working in Agile/SCRUM environment
More than three years of experience with a Big Data ecosystem (Google Cloud, Azure, Cloudera…)

Title: Senior Python Developer - International company - Healthcare
Description:
Senior Python Developer - International Company - Healthcare




Senior Python Developer - International company - Healthcare SaaS|International SaaS company specialized in Medical Devices and Digital Healthcare




About Our Client




Our client is an international company which has created a disruptive SaaS for the Health-care and Medical devices Sector.




Their SaaS product is based on Python with Django framework. They are working with Microservices Architecture, all hosted in GCP and with also AI components that make this product uniq in the sector.




They have different nationalities in their team and English is mandatory. Their culture is really flexible and they are currently working on a hybrid modality with 4 days of home office (of course you can come when you want).




Job Description




Design and implement new functionalities and architectures using Python and Django.
Design and implement solution architecture to meet functional and non-functional requirements.
Translate business requirements into technical deliverables.
Develop additional features on existing applications.
Modeling, designing, coding, testing automation, scripting, packaging
The Successful Applicant




Highly proficient with Python programming language.
Strong experience with Python frameworks, mostly Django, but if not we also value really positive experiences with Fast Api or Flask.
Proficient with, SQL/NoSQL databases and REST/SOAP webservices.
Experience or an interest in microservices / cloud environments (Docker, Kubernetes, GCP)
Fluent English.
What's on Offer




4 days of remote work per week.
Flexible Schedule.
Free health insurance.
Salary Budget: 40K-55K depending always on the experience.
Contact: Pierre Rivenc

Grupo Norconsulting is looking for a Front-End Developer for a huge startup company based in Barcelona to be involved in innovative and challenging projects, working in dynamic products.

To join the client directly in their offices in Barcelona and be a part of their consolidated team of developers.

Requirements

Experience in Front-End Development
Good knowledge of JavaScript, HTML5 and CSS3
Beginner experience of Vue JS, and advanced experienced in jQuery and Bootstrap
Understanding and experience on crossbrowsing & responsive design
Able to communicate technical issues with non-technical users
Ability to multi-task and manage tasks with varying priorities
Knowledge of git
Good knowledge of the use of APIs.

Nice to have

Demonstrated experience in JavaScript & Vue JS
Experience with version control tools and continuous integration
Knowledge of agile methodologies
Being a “problem solver”, positive attitude and ability to work in a team

Responsibilities

Programming and documentation of JavaScript, HTML and CSS.
Refactoring and maintenance of established front-end applications
Cooperation with other back-end / front-end developers to implement new product functionalities
Resolve and articulate complex problems through the UI / UX and the development of the front-end
Follow the patterns, practices and methods established in the existing code
Daily scrum and sprint plannings every 2-3 weeks
Communication with external web services

Programación en entrono .NET
C#
SQL
Azure

Pensamos en una persona con iniciativa y motivada por formar parte de un proyecto estable e integrarse en equipo de trabajo joven y dinámico.

Net, C#

Title: Full Stack Engineer (100% remote-friendly within Spain)
Description:
How would you be impacting our mission?





As a Full Stack Engineer, you will become a valuable member of the Integrations Team within our Integrations business domain. Your responsibilities will encompass both the design and implementation of solutions, while adhering to and promoting best practices in software analysis, design, and development.





As an Integrations Team, we focus on building APIs that our partners use to integrate with our healthcare products. We also create embeddable widgets that Clinics and Doctors use to boost their efficiency and experience without leaving the software of their choice. In this business domain, you will collaborate with fellow Engineers who are experts in Vue.js, Electron, .NET, and PHP.





Each team in the domain benefits from the guidance of a dedicated Product Manager and Team Leader. We employ modern product discovery techniques inspired by the works of Marty Cagan and Teresa Torres. In terms of workflow, we adopt the Shape Up methodology and empower our engineering teams with a high degree of autonomy. The current team size stands at six members.





In this role, your primary focus will be on the frontend aspects of the widgets, developed using Vue.js and our custom UI Kit. Occasionally, you may also collaborate with colleagues on PHP-related tasks during pair programming sessions to further enhance your skill set and contribute to the team's success.





Qualifications



What will help you thrive?



You have 4+ years of experience working on web applications.
You work with TypeScript and Vue.js.
You use tools like GIT, SASS, esbuild, Webpack, NPM.
You can work with PHP (Symfony) when it is needed.
You are familiar with Extreme Programming values, principles and techniques.
You feel comfortable working in a small team, owning processes, taking initiative and making decisions. We work in Shape Up!
You can communicate in English – both spoken and written - min. B2 level.
Growth mindset: nobody ticks all those boxes above, but willingness to learn is strongly valued here.

Bonus points:



You have experience working with UI Kit / Design System.
You have experience working with Docker.
You have experience with CI / CD, incremental work breakdown, feature flags and frequent deployments.
You have experience working in DevOps Culture.
You have basic knowledge of System Design and Architecture.

You’re an excellent fit for this role if:​​​​​​​



You are a person that has a constant desire to learn new things and share your knowledge with team members.
You have great attention to detail.
You are a great team player!







Additional Information



What will you get in return?





Let’s talk money



A salary adequate to your experience and skills between 44.000and 55.000EUR. The range is broad so that we can accommodate our roles for all levels of experience, but we will show you the career ladder to explain where we see your skills and impact within the company". Your salary will be, now and always, 100% transparent to you;
Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings;
Share options plan after 6 months of working with us.





True flexibility and work-life balance



Remote or hybrid work model with our hub in Barcelona;
Flexible working hours (fully flexible, as in most cases you only have to be on a couple of meetings weekly);
Summer intensive schedule during July and August (work 7 hours, finish earlier);
23 paid holidays, with exchangeable local bank holidays;
Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).





Health comes first



Private healthcare plan with Adeslas for you and subsidized for your family (medical and dental);
Access to hundreds of gyms for a symbolic fee in partnership for you and your family with Andjoy;
Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.





Keep growing with us



20% time rule: spend 20% of your working hours on personal development related to your role and collaboration with other teams;;
Free English and Spanish classes.



Are you from abroad?



Relocation support to Spain (we handle the bureaucracy, so you don’t have to);



We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you’re reading, there’s a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we’re lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you’ve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other.



“We believe all humans, in all their beautiful diversity, should have equal rights, dignity and respect. Period.” Mariusz Gralewski, CEO



Show more Show less

Title: Computer Vision Engineer
Description:
We are looking for an experienced computer vision engineer to join our newly opened Barcelona office and help us build the future of assistive devices for blind and visually impaired people.

biped is a smart harness that uses cameras to help blind and visually impaired people detect potential obstacles and follow navigation instructions. 2+ years of R&D, 300 beta-testers later, biped is now commercially available all across Europe.

Tasks

Take responsibility for core parts of our vision pipeline:

Improve obstacle detection robustness
Improve object detection & tracking
Design and develop quality assurance tools
Runtime optimization (C++ mostly)
Prototype and develop new features based on user feedback


Requirements

Your profile:

You are ready to learn new things and interested in pushing your code to production.
You are communicative and upfront about the problems you are facing and you like to work on challenging problems in a team.
You aim to have a core contribution to a massive problem. You are driven by the impact you want to have in your job.
You have already gained experience working on challenging problems.
You have an M.Sc. in computer science, robotics, maths, or physics and have 2+ years of experience in computer vision engineering.


We are looking for somebody that has significant experience with:

Python
C++
Linux


A plus would be past encounters with:

SLAM, visual odometry, and indoor navigation tasks
Embedded software / code optimization


Benefits

What we offer:

Competitive salary
Key employee status with stock options
25 days holidays (including 5 days at Christmas, company is closed)
Several hiring plans in Barcelona, expecting a growing team there
Come to Lausanne, Switzerland from time to time
Cool office space, 2 days / week fully remote, and we're flexible with that


The work environment:

biped is an equal career opportunity employer
We are a small team, focusing on personal and professional growth and help each other to achieve that on a daily basis
We solve real-life problems of our customers and see the immediate result of it
We have incredible mentors and implement best practices for the engineering team


Looks interesting? Send us your resume (and public projects if you have them!) and a short description of why you'd like to join. Keep it short. We are open to applications from outside of Spain as long as relocation is an option.

Process:

First phone interview with our CEO, getting to know each other
Technical challenge submitted by email and to solve within 1 week
Presenting your technical challenge solution to our CTO & CEO
Final discussion with the rest of the team / relevant people you'd be working with


Starting date: September 1st or earlier if possible. No software agency.

We'll get back to you quickly, promised 😎
Show more Show less
