Title: Data Scientist (Marketing & BI Department)
Description:
Somos Banco Sabadell



Más de 17.000 personas que trabajamos en equipo compartiendo nuestro esfuerzo para alcanzar una meta. Nos caracterizamos por nuestra implicación, espíritu de colaboración y dinamismo. Somos una entidad que en su larga y exitosa trayectoria ha sabido combinar la tradición en la forma de hacer banca, la visión a largo plazo, el crecimiento y la innovación. Una marca fuerte y reconocida en el entorno, para más de 11 millones de clientes que valoran la calidad de nuestros productos y nuestra apuesta por gestionar “su experiencia” como cliente.



Nuestra razón de ser es ayudar a personas y empresas a hacer realidad sus proyectos, anticipándonos y ocupándonos de que tomen las mejores decisiones económicas, a través de nuestros valores: el compromiso, no conformismo, profesionalidad, eficacia, empatía y franqueza.



Y además, lo hacemos mediante una gestión responsable y comprometida con el medio ambiente.



¡Únete a nosotros!



¿Qué estamos buscando?



Actualmente buscamos a un Data Scientist para incorporarse a nuestro equipo encargado de marketing e inteligencia de negocios.





Hablemos del proyecto...



Como Data Scientist, jugarás un papel crítico en la transformación de datos en conocimientos. Ayudando al área de negocio a tomar decisiones basadas en datos. Colaborarás con equipos interfuncionales para diseñar y desarrollar modelos predictivos, algoritmos y análisis que impulsan el valor comercial en sus líneas de productos. Trabajarás en problemas complejos de datos utilizando una variedad de herramientas analíticas y técnicas estadísticas, y serás responsable de comunicar conocimientos y recomendaciones a las partes interesadas en toda la organización. 



Entre tus responsabilidades principales:



Trabajarás con equipos interfuncionales para identificar y priorizar problemas comerciales que puedan resolverse mediante enfoques basados en datos.

Utilizarás técnicas estadísticas y algoritmos de aprendizaje automático para desarrollar modelos predictivos que se puedan utilizar para optimizar decisiones de marketing y negocios.

Realizarás análisis exploratorios de datos y desarrollarás visualizaciones para comunicar conocimientos a las partes interesadas.

Colaborarás con los equipos de TI e ingeniería de datos para desarrollar pipelines de datos y procesos ETL que respalden los análisis basados en datos.

Desarrollarás e implementarás experimentos basados en datos para probar hipótesis y optimizar campañas de marketing.

Identificarás oportunidades para mejorar la calidad de los datos y las prácticas de gobernanza de los datos.

Te mantendrás actualizado sobre las últimas tendencias y desarrollos en data science y machine learning.

¿Qué valoramos de tu candidatura? 




Master o doctorado en un campo cuantitativo (estadística, matemáticas, física, ingeniería o informática).

Al menos 3 años de experiencia en un rol de ciencia de datos o análisis, preferentemente en un contexto de marketing o BI.

Fuertes habilidades de programación en lenguajes como Python, R o SQL.

Experiencia con técnicas de modelado estadístico y aprendizaje automático como regresión lineal, regresión logística, árboles de decisión, bosques aleatorios y redes neuronales.

Experiencia trabajando con conjuntos de datos grandes y complejos y construyendo pipelines de datos utilizando herramientas como Snowflake, SAS

Conocimiento de herramientas de visualización de datos como PowerBI o Dossiers.

Fuertes habilidades de comunicación y colaboración, con la capacidad de trabajar efectivamente con las partes interesadas en diferentes funciones y niveles de la organización.
Nivel medio/alto de inglés.

Entre los beneficios:



Salario competitivo más beneficios sociales.
Podrás disfrutar de una amplia oferta formativa.
Ampliarás tu red de contactos a través de la colaboración y espacios de networking.
Contarás con opciones de desarrollo de carrera y movilidad dentro del Grupo reales..
Contratación indefinida.
Flexibilidad horaria.
Modalidad de trabajo híbrido.
25 días laborables de vacaciones.
Productos y servicios financieros exclusivos para empleados.






Banco Sabadell está comprometido en promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, orientación sexual, religión, etnia o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.



 



Banco Sabadell forma parte de la red de empresas con el distintivo de “Igualdad en la Empresa” otorgado por el Ministerio de Igualdad.
 




Show more Show less
HTML:
Somos Banco Sabadell

Más de 17.000 personas que trabajamos en equipo compartiendo nuestro esfuerzo para alcanzar una meta. Nos caracterizamos por nuestra implicación, espíritu de colaboración y dinamismo. Somos una entidad que en su larga y exitosa trayectoria ha sabido combinar la tradición en la forma de hacer banca, la visión a largo plazo, el crecimiento y la innovación. Una marca fuerte y reconocida en el entorno, para más de 11 millones de clientes que valoran la calidad de nuestros productos y nuestra apuesta por gestionar “su experiencia” como cliente.

Nuestra razón de ser es ayudar a personas y empresas a hacer realidad sus proyectos, anticipándonos y ocupándonos de que tomen las mejores decisiones económicas, a través de nuestros valores: el compromiso, no conformismo, profesionalidad, eficacia, empatía y franqueza.

Y además, lo hacemos mediante una gestión responsable y comprometida con el medio ambiente.

¡Únete a nosotros!

¿Qué estamos buscando?

Actualmente buscamos a un Data Scientist para incorporarse a nuestro equipo encargado de marketing e inteligencia de negocios.



Hablemos del proyecto...

Como Data Scientist, jugarás un papel crítico en la transformación de datos en conocimientos. Ayudando al área de negocio a tomar decisiones basadas en datos. Colaborarás con equipos interfuncionales para diseñar y desarrollar modelos predictivos, algoritmos y análisis que impulsan el valor comercial en sus líneas de productos. Trabajarás en problemas complejos de datos utilizando una variedad de herramientas analíticas y técnicas estadísticas, y serás responsable de comunicar conocimientos y recomendaciones a las partes interesadas en toda la organización. 

Entre tus responsabilidades principales:

  • Trabajarás con equipos interfuncionales para identificar y priorizar problemas comerciales que puedan resolverse mediante enfoques basados en datos.
  • Utilizarás técnicas estadísticas y algoritmos de aprendizaje automático para desarrollar modelos predictivos que se puedan utilizar para optimizar decisiones de marketing y negocios.
  • Realizarás análisis exploratorios de datos y desarrollarás visualizaciones para comunicar conocimientos a las partes interesadas.
  • Colaborarás con los equipos de TI e ingeniería de datos para desarrollar pipelines de datos y procesos ETL que respalden los análisis basados en datos.
  • Desarrollarás e implementarás experimentos basados en datos para probar hipótesis y optimizar campañas de marketing.
  • Identificarás oportunidades para mejorar la calidad de los datos y las prácticas de gobernanza de los datos.
  • Te mantendrás actualizado sobre las últimas tendencias y desarrollos en data science y machine learning.

¿Qué valoramos de tu candidatura? 


  • Master o doctorado en un campo cuantitativo (estadística, matemáticas, física, ingeniería o informática).
  • Al menos 3 años de experiencia en un rol de ciencia de datos o análisis, preferentemente en un contexto de marketing o BI.
  • Fuertes habilidades de programación en lenguajes como Python, R o SQL.
  • Experiencia con técnicas de modelado estadístico y aprendizaje automático como regresión lineal, regresión logística, árboles de decisión, bosques aleatorios y redes neuronales.
  • Experiencia trabajando con conjuntos de datos grandes y complejos y construyendo pipelines de datos utilizando herramientas como Snowflake, SAS
  • Conocimiento de herramientas de visualización de datos como PowerBI o Dossiers.
  • Fuertes habilidades de comunicación y colaboración, con la capacidad de trabajar efectivamente con las partes interesadas en diferentes funciones y niveles de la organización.
  • Nivel medio/alto de inglés.

Entre los beneficios:

  • Salario competitivo más beneficios sociales.
  • Podrás disfrutar de una amplia oferta formativa.
  • Ampliarás tu red de contactos a través de la colaboración y espacios de networking.
  • Contarás con opciones de desarrollo de carrera y movilidad dentro del Grupo reales..
  • Contratación indefinida.
  • Flexibilidad horaria.
  • Modalidad de trabajo híbrido.
  • 25 días laborables de vacaciones.
  • Productos y servicios financieros exclusivos para empleados.




Banco Sabadell está comprometido en promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, orientación sexual, religión, etnia o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.

 

Banco Sabadell forma parte de la red de empresas con el distintivo de “Igualdad en la Empresa” otorgado por el Ministerio de Igualdad.

Title: Solutions Engineer
Description:
About Us

AfterShip is an automation platform that empowers eCommerce retailers to create and manage the world's best online shopping experiences. Powering the tracking of over 4.4billion order shipments for 14,000 eCommerce retailers like Amazon, Harry's and Kylie Cosmetics, AfterShip is the one-stop shop for eCommerce tools that support website pop-ups, advanced email flows, page building, shipment visibility, branded shipment tracking, proactive email and SMS notifications, returns, and exchanges.

Our strong product market fit, prioritizing solving real problems for our customers, has resulted in a strong growth trajectory for the company. We secured a 66 million dollar Series B in 2021.

At AfterShip, we are building a diverse and high-performing culture that encourages collaboration and experimentation on a global scale. Even as a company with over 10 years under our belt and 450 AfterShippers across our 8 global offices, we embrace a dynamic and agile approach to our work.

We operate with a flat team structure, where you will have opportunities to contribute your ideas and take ownership over your work to create meaningful impact for the business and the customers we serve. If you're looking for a vehicle to achieve your professional goals and work alongside fantastic teams, we invite you to join us.

Your Mission:

The Solutions Engineer is part of the rapidly growing AfterShip sales organization. The primary goal of this role is to successfully increase the sales and adoption of the AfterShip solutions by working alongside the Account Executives to effectively demonstrate AfterShip's offerings to and answer technical questions for enterprise-level corporate prospects. This Solutions Engineer will work closely with the Sales and Customer Success teams to ensure the prospective client understands what they are purchasing and, upon contract signatures, experiences a seamless onboarding experience.

What You'll Do:

Work with the Account Executives to consultatively engage with prospective clients to identify and develop solutions that meet their needs
Define project scope based on the prospect's needs and requirements
Deliver product POC and demonstrations that are tailored to the prospect's technical requirements and audience
Work to ensure the total buy-in of the AfterShip platform and capabilities by the prospect's development team
Providing customer training to set them up for success with AfterShip's solutions
Ensure completion of projects on-time and on-budget


Who We're Looking For:

A Bachelor's degree is required, preferably in a technical field
Excellent presentation and communication skills
Have customer-facing consulting experience in software implementation and service deployment
Self-motivated to dig in to learn about products, technology, customers and competitors
Familiarity with eCommerce platforms (e.g. Shopify, Magento, BigCommerce)
Knowledge of APIs and previous exposure to programming languages like Go, Node.js, Java, React, and TypeScript – You won't need to write code, but you will need to be able to effectively collaborate between our clients and our Product and Engineering teams
Strong project management and resource management skills
Ability to manage numerous projects simultaneously and work well under deadlines


At AfterShip, we understand that not all applicants will have skills that match the job description exactly. We value diverse experiences and respect that experience comes in many different forms, so even if you feel you may not meet every qualification to a T then we still encourage you to apply. We are always looking for people who can help us continue to raise the bar for our team and who want to join us on our mission.

Why You Should Join Us:

We are super proud of our diverse and geeky culture, started by our software engineer turned CEO and cultivated by a group of amazing people from all over the world. You'll be part of a solutions-oriented team that puts egos aside to achieve new milestones and tackle challenges together.
We're a remote-first team, meaning by default that employees work from home or on a hybrid-flexible basis in our hub locations (Toronto, Austin, Barcelona). You're empowered to choose a work setup that works best for you and your team. With flexible hours depending on your time zone, you'll be able to have a schedule that fits your working style and the requirements of your role.
We have great ambition to make buying and selling easier for everyone in this world -- one of the most exciting spaces for a technology start-up to be in. There is virtually no ceiling for either what you will be doing or learning here, and we want to support you to grow exponentially, along with the company.


Perks:

Competitive compensation
Remote-first/hybrid-flexible work setups
Healthcare coverage offered from day 1
Career progression & professional development
Flexible PTO policy
Invest in your learning + monthly book perk
In-office lunch and commuter benefits for those located in our hub locations


We are an equal opportunity employer. In addition, we are committed to providing accommodations for applicants upon request at any stage of the recruitment process in accordance with the legislative requirements of this job's location. Please let us know if you require accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

Title: Científic/a de Dades (Data Scientist)
Company: Fundació de Recerca Sant Joan de Déu
Description:
A partir de les dades de seqüenciació massiva de panells gènics, exomes o genomes, s’han generat procediments estandarditzats per la detecció de variants putatives de ser causants d’una patologia.

En la majoria de casos, la utilitat clínica de les dades genètiques i genòmiques només es materialitza després de l'agregació de dades, quan les dades del pacient s'interpreten conjuntament amb dades d'altres pacients i de la població general.

Combinant la informació fenotípica, genòmic i contextual d'una varietat d'individus, facilita la identificació i caracterització de variants genètiques, permetre la determinació de les causes subjacents de les malalties genètiques i permetent el seu diagnòstic.

La manca d’una aproximació d’aquest tipus pot enraderir el diagnòstic molecular o promoure diagnòstics erronis, el que condueix a intervencions mèdiques inadequades en detriment del pacient i la seva família.

Els objectius principals d'aquest projecte són:

1- Establiment d'una Xarxa de Recerca Genètica per a la Medicina de Precisió a Espanya;

2- Integració de dades fenotípiques estandaritzades (Human Phenotype Ontology) amb dades genotipiques;

3-Implementació d'eines automatitzades de compartició de dades anonimitzades.

El projecte desplegarà una plataforma federada de dades seguint les directrius, la documentació i els demostradors desenvolupats per IMPaCT-Data.

Funcions Principals:

Desenvolupament i implementació d’una base de dades genòmica-clínica
Desenvolupament i implementació de les eines de preprocessat i anàlisi de dades del projecte
Contribuir als entregables del projecte


Què oferim:

Contracte 6 mesos, lligat al projecte IMPaCT-Data.

El presente contrato está subvencionado por el ISCIII con código de expediente IMP/00019 y cofinanciado por la Unión Europea por el Fondo Europeo de Desarrollo Regional (FEDER), “Una manera de hacer Europa”

Requisits:

Requisits:

Estar en possessió del títol de Bioenginyeria, Enginyeria Informàtica, Enginyeria de Dades o equivalent.
Coneixements o experiència en bases de dades no relacionals, MongoDB.
Es valorarà positivament experiència en l'àmbit sanitari i en gestió de dades genòmiques

Title: Software Developer (Team Solar)
Description:
Description

Who we are?

We are Holaluz and we were born to change the world.

You and the planet are what moves us to be who we are and to do what we do. In this video, Carlota Pi, one of the three founders of Holaluz, tells you more about it.

Our desire to do things differently has brought us to lead the transformation of the energy sector. Because:


We only sell 100% renewable electricity.
Thanks to leveraging the use of technology, we offer you personalized products and rates that allow you to save money.
We put you at the center of all our decisions.


There’s more of us wanting to change things. At Holaluz we want to turn every square meter of the roofs into inexhaustible sources of renewable energy for more than 40 million people and at no cost to you.

So that no matter where you live, whether or not you have your own roof,… you can be part of the change just by joining Holaluz's 100% green energy.

All the energy we need is up there. It is ours, it is clean and it is inexhaustible.

Can you help us connecting people to 100% green energy💡💚?

What will you do?

You will join a multidisciplinary team where you will plan, improve and develop tools that allow us to provide solutions, always putting the customer at the center.

In Holaluz you will grow, learn and also help to grow. Everything is a challenge in Holaluz right now!

We also expect from you to contribute to the development of presentations, materials, and other strategy-related documents to be shared both internally and externally.

And #SayThingsAsTheyAre is one of our values, we want to be clear and transparent in explaining what you will do during your first 6 months at Holaluz.

In 1 month:


After the first month you will know how everything is set up, you will have mastered our culture and know the vision of Holaluz, you will have met with all stakeholders and you will know what they need.
You will have done 1o1 with the people in your team and understood their needs, fears, objectives... as well as their interests and motivations. You will have participated in meetings with other Engineering Managers to share tools, doubts, advice...
You will have gone to lunch one day with people from the team, you will have attended a Tech Show and Tell (weekly internal event to flow 🌊 knowledge), a Lean Code (biweekly internal event to discuss topics proposed by the attendees themselves), and a Book Club (technical book club).


In 3 months:


You will have had several 1:1s with your manager to find out how you feel in your first months at Holaluz and help you grow based on your interests.
I'm sure you will have already made many decisions on how to bring value to your team and you will be working side by side with your colleagues on how to generate more impact and connect people to green energy 💚💡.
You will have enjoyed some team building with the team and you will already know the names of some people from other teams.


In 6 months:


You will have (almost) everything under control and you will have contributed to the maturity and growth of your team. You will have contributed value beyond it by sharing knowledge and getting fully involved in continuously improving it.


How will you do it?

One of our values is #KeepRowing, meaning that teamwork and team alignment is essential to be able to move forward and meet our shared objectives.

At Holaluz we have built a robust and constantly iterating organisational system, which allows us to adapt to the constant changes demanded by the sector and to achieve the purpose we pursue, using various methodologies, including SCRUM. At Holaluz, meetings and decisions are made collaboratively, feedback flows 🤟 between the different teams and support between people is promoted.

What do we have?

At Holaluz we work with multidisciplinary teams, working closely with the product team and purpose-driven.

Our systems are stable and we do several daily deployments without fear because it is tested and automated in Jenkins and GitHub Actions.

Our infrastructure is in code with version control and each team is responsible for maintaining their own. We will help you to have the infrastructure resources that your team needs every moment.

Finally, we work with Best practices, such as Solid principles, hexagonal architecture, TDD, DDD and Agile methodology (Kanban). We always test our code with unit, integration and acceptance tests.

Who will you do it with?

We are a team of almost 700 people with an unbeatable atmosphere... Don't you believe us? Let me introduce you to your colleagues 😁.

#AlwaysPeopleFirst and #HaveFun are also very important values in Holaluz, and in any challenge it is important that it is interesting but also the people with whom you are going to share this adventure.

Within the great Technology team, we have teams by purpose. In your case, you will be part of the Solar team. The wonderful and fascinating thing about this area is that everything is to be done! Can you imagine being able to improve the world from 0?

And how do I know if I can fit into this team?

Overall, what unites us is that we like to work as a team and that we are #blaming haters: Our mantra is successes and failures. We celebrate them together and both use them as opportunities to learn.

Are you up for joining the crew?

Where will you do it?

Another way of #KeepRowing is rowing all together in perfect synchronisation and towards a common goal, and what a better place to do it than in our offices in Barcelona, just 200 metres from the sea 🌊. This exceptional location next to the beach is perfect for a break with a dip and to put into practice another of our #HaveFun values.

But since March the number of "Holaluz offices" has multiplied by 260, everyone has their own little Holaluz, with their sea views (or not), their coffee or tea machine, their open space for lunch, their meeting rooms (now with a little more availability), and also their routines and organisation. We are committed to individuality and flexibility by putting people at the core of our decisions, that's why our offices are open for those who need or want to work in them. We are working on flexible seating in the office and providing individual lockers for everyone, as well as adapting all the meeting rooms so that we can make better video-conferencing and continue to work as comfortably as possible from home or from the office.

Requirements

What do we need?


Some seniority working as Backend Developer 🙂.
We build solutions for our clients using Java and Kotlin, and sometimes we struggle with legacy PHP. In addition, we are autonomous to deploy our applications and infrastructure on AWS using Terraform. You don't need to know all this tech stack, but you do need to be interested in learning about it :)
You care about code quality. We consider QA a skill and not a role.
You have an interest in Extreme Programming and methodologies that allow us to deliver value as quickly as possible to our customers.
You are a mature, creative, flexible person and you like Rock & Roll 🤘.
You like to stay connected and play 👽. Within our team we work with platforms that help us to make telecommuting more enjoyable and fun.


Benefits

What do we offer?

We offer a series of measures and tools so that you can develop yourself 360º and achieve everything you set out to do, both personally and professionally. In line with this, we believe that the most powerful energy comes from people, so #AlwaysPeopleFirst is part of our DNA, therefore, you will have the opportunity to:


Get a competitive share-based compensation plan with significant tax subsidies for non-Spanish talent that has not worked in Spain for the past 10 years;
Join a company where people come first, with an unbeatable working environment and great talent where we truly live and believe in our values – all that while being a goal-oriented and results-driven company that applies agile methodologies and a proven scaling philosophy to everything we do. Plus, earn a Referral Bonus if you bring in people as talented as you;
Have flexible working hours and the possibility of working remotely 1-2 days a week, as a result of our pro-responsibility and self-determined mindset, and our commitment to the self-management of the team's time;
Enjoy a working environment where also the 'details' fit your needs. We have our own library, organic fruit, and reduced subscription to Andjoy - which includes yoga and CrossFit classes in the office;
Be part of a baby-friendly company. Nursery to help integrate life and work for new parents. "Casals" (summer camps in summer but also in other holidays) those weeks of the year when combining children's holidays and work becomes a little more complicated. We offer preferential rates for kindergarten, transportation and food with Cobee (our flexible retribution system);
Take free English and Catalan lessons at the office;
Get access to discounted pricing on private health insurance (Adeslas);
Competitive & sustainable mobility rate with eCooltra for Holaluz. These are electric bikes and scooters, so you can get to the office quickly and economically. We also offer a competitive Wifi rate with Unique.


We celebrate diversity in the world and we want our team to reflect this in an inclusive way. At Holaluz, we are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of ethnicity, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression. Additionally, we strive to empower women in the workplace.
Show more Show less
HTML:
Description

Who we are?

We are Holaluz and we were born to change the world.

You and the planet are what moves us to be who we are and to do what we do. In this video, Carlota Pi, one of the three founders of Holaluz, tells you more about it.

Our desire to do things differently has brought us to lead the transformation of the energy sector. Because:

  • We only sell 100% renewable electricity.
  • Thanks to leveraging the use of technology, we offer you personalized products and rates that allow you to save money.
  • We put you at the center of all our decisions.

There’s more of us wanting to change things. At Holaluz we want to turn every square meter of the roofs into inexhaustible sources of renewable energy for more than 40 million people and at no cost to you.

So that no matter where you live, whether or not you have your own roof,… you can be part of the change just by joining Holaluz's 100% green energy.

All the energy we need is up there. It is ours, it is clean and it is inexhaustible.

Can you help us connecting people to 100% green energy💡💚?

What will you do?

You will join a multidisciplinary team where you will plan, improve and develop tools that allow us to provide solutions, always putting the customer at the center.

In Holaluz you will grow, learn and also help to grow. Everything is a challenge in Holaluz right now!

We also expect from you to contribute to the development of presentations, materials, and other strategy-related documents to be shared both internally and externally.

And #SayThingsAsTheyAre is one of our values, we want to be clear and transparent in explaining what you will do during your first 6 months at Holaluz.

In 1 month:

  • After the first month you will know how everything is set up, you will have mastered our culture and know the vision of Holaluz, you will have met with all stakeholders and you will know what they need.
  • You will have done 1o1 with the people in your team and understood their needs, fears, objectives... as well as their interests and motivations. You will have participated in meetings with other Engineering Managers to share tools, doubts, advice...
  • You will have gone to lunch one day with people from the team, you will have attended a Tech Show and Tell (weekly internal event to flow 🌊 knowledge), a Lean Code (biweekly internal event to discuss topics proposed by the attendees themselves), and a Book Club (technical book club).

In 3 months:

  • You will have had several 1:1s with your manager to find out how you feel in your first months at Holaluz and help you grow based on your interests.
  • I'm sure you will have already made many decisions on how to bring value to your team and you will be working side by side with your colleagues on how to generate more impact and connect people to green energy 💚💡.
  • You will have enjoyed some team building with the team and you will already know the names of some people from other teams.

In 6 months:

  • You will have (almost) everything under control and you will have contributed to the maturity and growth of your team. You will have contributed value beyond it by sharing knowledge and getting fully involved in continuously improving it.

How will you do it?

One of our values is #KeepRowing, meaning that teamwork and team alignment is essential to be able to move forward and meet our shared objectives.

At Holaluz we have built a robust and constantly iterating organisational system, which allows us to adapt to the constant changes demanded by the sector and to achieve the purpose we pursue, using various methodologies, including SCRUM. At Holaluz, meetings and decisions are made collaboratively, feedback flows 🤟 between the different teams and support between people is promoted.

What do we have?

At Holaluz we work with multidisciplinary teams, working closely with the product team and purpose-driven.

Our systems are stable and we do several daily deployments without fear because it is tested and automated in Jenkins and GitHub Actions.

Our infrastructure is in code with version control and each team is responsible for maintaining their own. We will help you to have the infrastructure resources that your team needs every moment.

Finally, we work with Best practices, such as Solid principles, hexagonal architecture, TDD, DDD and Agile methodology (Kanban). We always test our code with unit, integration and acceptance tests.

Who will you do it with?

We are a team of almost 700 people with an unbeatable atmosphere... Don't you believe us? Let me introduce you to your colleagues 😁.

#AlwaysPeopleFirst and #HaveFun are also very important values in Holaluz, and in any challenge it is important that it is interesting but also the people with whom you are going to share this adventure.

Within the great Technology team, we have teams by purpose. In your case, you will be part of the Solar team. The wonderful and fascinating thing about this area is that everything is to be done! Can you imagine being able to improve the world from 0?

And how do I know if I can fit into this team?

Overall, what unites us is that we like to work as a team and that we are #blaming haters: Our mantra is successes and failures. We celebrate them together and both use them as opportunities to learn.

Are you up for joining the crew?

Where will you do it?

Another way of #KeepRowing is rowing all together in perfect synchronisation and towards a common goal, and what a better place to do it than in our offices in Barcelona, just 200 metres from the sea 🌊. This exceptional location next to the beach is perfect for a break with a dip and to put into practice another of our #HaveFun values.

But since March the number of "Holaluz offices" has multiplied by 260, everyone has their own little Holaluz, with their sea views (or not), their coffee or tea machine, their open space for lunch, their meeting rooms (now with a little more availability), and also their routines and organisation. We are committed to individuality and flexibility by putting people at the core of our decisions, that's why our offices are open for those who need or want to work in them. We are working on flexible seating in the office and providing individual lockers for everyone, as well as adapting all the meeting rooms so that we can make better video-conferencing and continue to work as comfortably as possible from home or from the office.

Requirements

What do we need?

  • Some seniority working as Backend Developer 🙂.
  • We build solutions for our clients using Java and Kotlin, and sometimes we struggle with legacy PHP. In addition, we are autonomous to deploy our applications and infrastructure on AWS using Terraform. You don't need to know all this tech stack, but you do need to be interested in learning about it :)
  • You care about code quality. We consider QA a skill and not a role.
  • You have an interest in Extreme Programming and methodologies that allow us to deliver value as quickly as possible to our customers.
  • You are a mature, creative, flexible person and you like Rock & Roll 🤘.
  • You like to stay connected and play 👽. Within our team we work with platforms that help us to make telecommuting more enjoyable and fun.

Benefits

What do we offer?

We offer a series of measures and tools so that you can develop yourself 360º and achieve everything you set out to do, both personally and professionally. In line with this, we believe that the most powerful energy comes from people, so #AlwaysPeopleFirst is part of our DNA, therefore, you will have the opportunity to:

  • Get a competitive share-based compensation plan with significant tax subsidies for non-Spanish talent that has not worked in Spain for the past 10 years;
  • Join a company where people come first, with an unbeatable working environment and great talent where we truly live and believe in our values – all that while being a goal-oriented and results-driven company that applies agile methodologies and a proven scaling philosophy to everything we do. Plus, earn a Referral Bonus if you bring in people as talented as you;
  • Have flexible working hours and the possibility of working remotely 1-2 days a week, as a result of our pro-responsibility and self-determined mindset, and our commitment to the self-management of the team's time;
  • Enjoy a working environment where also the 'details' fit your needs. We have our own library, organic fruit, and reduced subscription to Andjoy - which includes yoga and CrossFit classes in the office;
  • Be part of a baby-friendly company. Nursery to help integrate life and work for new parents. "Casals" (summer camps in summer but also in other holidays) those weeks of the year when combining children's holidays and work becomes a little more complicated. We offer preferential rates for kindergarten, transportation and food with Cobee (our flexible retribution system);
  • Take free English and Catalan lessons at the office;
  • Get access to discounted pricing on private health insurance (Adeslas);
  • Competitive & sustainable mobility rate with eCooltra for Holaluz. These are electric bikes and scooters, so you can get to the office quickly and economically. We also offer a competitive Wifi rate with Unique.

We celebrate diversity in the world and we want our team to reflect this in an inclusive way. At Holaluz, we are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of ethnicity, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression. Additionally, we strive to empower women in the workplace.

Title: Ingeniera/o de Software. Microservicios
Description:
Nuestra compañía es uno de los mayores grupos de construcción en España y México, con sedes en Polonia, Perú, Chile o Uruguay. Dedicado al desarrollo de infraestructuras de obra civil y ferroviaria, que opera además en los sectores industrial, energías renovables y concesiones y edificación.




En estos momentos buscamos incorporar una/un Software Engineer para una de las filiales de Grupo Aldesa (ACISA) especializada en la ejecución de proyectos de movilidad y eficiencia energética; proyectos de tráfico, vehículos conectados, control de accesos y smartcities e ITS.




La persona seleccionada participará en el desarrollo de varios verticales en nuestra plataforma microservicios, y buscamos gente con experiencia en herramientas como Spring boot, Kubernetes, contenedores y resto de herramientas y conocimientos auxiliares relacionados con DEVOPS y SRE.




Por otro lado, estamos diseñando producto para ser integrados en redes 5G, a través de proyectos de innovación y europeos con universidades y empresas internacionales. Son proyectos realmente interesantes y retadores a nivel tecnológico.




Nuestra plataforma cloud de referencia es Google Cloud Platform (GCP), aunque desplegamos sistema híbridos: cloud - servidores on premises.




Buscamos personas con experiencia trabajando en proyectos de microservicios, spring cloud / spring boot. Así como experiencia en desarrollo cloud y Java 8 o superior.




¿Qué haremos por ti?




Ofrecerte un contrato indefinido y un entorno agradable y duradero.
Un salario acorde con tu experiencia y capacidad.
Te mostraremos nuestro plan de retribución flexible (ticket transporte, restaurante, seguro médico y guardería).
Facilitarte opciones formativas adaptadas a tu posición así como aprendizaje constante.




GRUPO ALDESA es una empresa comprometida con la igualdad de trato y oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres, sin discriminar directa o indirectamente por razón de sexo. En cumplimiento de este compromiso como uno de sus valores fundamentales, la empresa cuenta con un Plan de Igualdad según los criterios recogidos en la Ley Orgánica 3/2007, de 22 de marzo, para la igualdad efectiva de mujeres y hombres, y en el Real Decreto-Ley 6/2019, de 1 de marzo, de medidas urgentes para garantía de la igualdad de trato y de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres en el empleo y la ocupación. Los procesos de reclutamiento y selección de personal, incluida la gestión en la recepción de candidaturas espontáneas, cumplen estrictamente estos principios de igualdad que abarcan cualquier otra circunstancia como raza, origen incluido el racial o étnico, estado civil, religión, convicciones, orientación sexual, etc.

Title: Data Engineer (Python + AWS)
Description:
¡Hola!




Si eres un apasionado/a del mundo del dato y estás en busca de un reto en proyectos internacionales, ¡esta oferta es para ti!




En estos momentos estamos buscando incorporar al equipo un Data Engineer que realizará las siguientes funciones:




Desarrollar y comprender los procesos de negocio para su área funcional asignada / objetos de datos.
Creación y mantenimiento de programas de carga de datos.
Mantener documentación relacionada con la migración de datos.
Ejecución de cargas de datos.
Análisis de la calidad y mejora continua de los datos maestros.




¿Cuáles son los requisitos? 👀




Mínimo 4 años de experiencia proyectos similares.
Lenguaje de programación : Python con análisis y visualización de datos
Lenguaje de consulta : SQL, fundamentalmente con AWS Redshift como Datawarehouse.
Tecnologías de virtualización : Docker & Kuberntes.
Cloud: AWS (DynamoDB, Fargate, AWS Batch)




¿Desde dónde trabajarás? 📍




Híbrido. Presencialidad 1 día a la semana en las oficinas del cliente en Barcelona.




¿Qué implica formar parte de la #Familiaat? 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦




Plan de carrera 🏄 Tu crecimiento es el nuestro, por eso, todos nuestros profesionales tienen a su disposición procesos diseñados específicamente para sus funciones dentro de la compañía: modelo de competencias, evaluaciones, planes de formación y certificación, proyectos y eventos.




Retribución Flexible 💰Podrás optar por cheques restaurante, cheques guardería, tarjeta de transporte, o seguro médico. Junto los beneficios y descuentos que te proponemos al unirte al Club de ventajas AT.




Conciliación vida familiar y laboral 💆Nos gusta que tengas equilibrio en tu vida personal y en tu carrera profesional, por lo que disfrutamos de 22 días de vacaciones + 2 días de libre disposición + 24 y 31 de diciembre, además de opciones de teletrabajo, horario flexible y jornada intensiva los viernes y en verano.




Formación continua 💻 como medio para conseguir el desarrollo personal y profesional de nuestros compañeros. Tendrás opciones para formarte en últimas tecnologías, inglés, competencias/habilidades. Además de nuestro programa de certificaciones oficiales y las licencias de Udemy Business.




Wellness 🔋Promovemos un estilo de vida saludable entre todos los que formamos atSistemas y, por eso, contamos con varias iniciativas que fomentan nuestra salud y bienestar. Nuestro equipo de People Care está siempre a tu disposición para que las experiencias en atSistemas sean humanas y lo más alegres posible.




Nos gusta celebrar los momentos especiales 🎉 Así que estate atento a lo largo del año porque recibirás alguna que otra sorpresa




Conviértete en Embajador AT 😎 a través del Friends Mood.




...¡entre otras muchas cosas!




Si tienes cualquier duda o quieres ampliar la información, no dudes en contactar con cualquiera de los compañeros de People & Talent.

Title: Software Engineer
Place: Sant Boi de Llobregat, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Company Description

At Frasers Group we’re rethinking retail. Through digital innovation and unique store experiences, we’re serving our consumers with the world’s best sports, premium and luxury brands globally. As a leader in the industry, we’re elevating the retail experience for our consumers through our collection of established brands, including Sports Direct, FLANNELS, USC, Frasers, and GAME.

We present an ideal opportunity for someone who is passionate about technology and wants to deliver the absolute best that they can and keep innovation at the forefront. We have a £5,000 per head annual training budget within IT, as well as bonus schemes including our Frasers Champion where 8 peer nominated winners earn double their monthly salary for their outstanding performance

Job Description

This role is a great opportunity for skilled Engineers who are enthusiastic about delivering quality software to support our large-scale automated logistics operations. You’ll have the opportunity to design, build and support features including state-of-the-art automation that enable our operational teams to deliver exceptional value to our customers within the Frasers Group Brand.

Our Logistics Development team is a strong in-house team who are passionate about delivering quality software to support the growth of our warehouse operations. We’re on a transformational journey to improve our in-house software and develop new features that will continue to drive our rapid expansion. From improvements to picking, packing and loading processes to integrating multi-million-pound warehouse automation, each day will be like no other!

We use a varied development stack within our team and strongly encourage cross-training of the technologies we use. Within your day-to-day role you’ll be working on projects making use of technologies such as Oracle Exadata, SQL Server, .NET Core, WebAPI, Kafka and much more! Our in-house systems make heavy use of our Oracle / SQL so strong database knowledge is a must.

This role is available on a mainly remote basis with office presence required around once per month

Qualifications

3+ years’ experience as a software engineer within an agile development team
Natural problem solver, able to use your own initiative and find creative solutions to complex problems
A thorough understanding of SQL/PL-SQL, either Microsoft SQL Server 2012+ or Oracle PL-SQL
C# / .NET Framework / .NET 6
Experience debugging complicated database procedural logic
Strong database design & implementation
A passion for learning and progressing your technical skills
Comfortable working with stakeholders at all levels gathering information to progress work
Additional Information

To Be Able To Make The Most Of It You Need To Live And Breathe Our Principles

An opportunity like this at Frasers is for the fearless. The potential is massive, the experience unrivalled.

Think without limits and take the team with you
Own it and back yourself
Don 't hesitate and act with purpose
Be commercial and customer-focused.
Show more Show less

  • Own it and back yourself
  • Don 't hesitate and act with purpose
  • Be commercial and customer-focused.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Overview




About D+A at PepsiCo




PepsiCo is using the power of data to transform the way our world-famous portfolio of brands is sold every day. Our Data & Analytics organization influences every aspect of how we sell and move our products. In just a short period of time, they’ve built new capabilities that have defined the roadmap across all our brands. Members of our team solve complex problems facing our rapidly changing business and get to see their work come to life in the real world.




Data Science




Join our Data Science team where you will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where you will be responsible of building deployable statistical/machine learning models, starting from the discovery phase. You will work closely with process owners, product owners and final business users. This will provide you the correct visibility and understanding of criticality of your developments.




Your mission




Your role will be to be part of growing team based in Barcelona, to create and support global digital developments for PepsiCo. These developments will be focus on Consumer Analytics and Innovation but with the option in the future to collaborate into other fields such as revenue management, supply chain, manufacturing, logistics.




You will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where you will be responsible of building deployable statistical/machine learning models, starting from the discovery phase. You will work closely with process owners, product owners and final business users. This will provide you the correct visibility and understanding of criticality of your developments.




You will be an internal ambassador of the team’s culture around data and analytics. You will provide stewardship to colleagues in the areas that you are an specialist or you are specializing.




Responsibilities




Your day to day with us:




Refine requirements into modelling problems.
Set KPIs and metrics to evaluate analytics solution given a particular use case.
Research state-of-the-art methodologies.
Create documentation for learnings and knowledge transfer.
Create reusable packages or libraries
Work with cloud environments (such as Databricks)
Build CI / CD pipelines
Support large-scale experimentation and build data-driven models.
Using visualizations tools (such as PowerBi) to demonstrate insights of the data&results.
Partner with data engineers to ensure data access for discovery and proper data is prepared for model consumption.
Partner with ML engineers working on industrialization.
Coordinate work activities with Business teams, other IT services and as required.
Drive the use of the Platform toolset and to also focus on 'the art of the possible' demonstrations to the business as needed.
Communicate with business stakeholders in the process of service design, training and knowledge transfer.
Influence product teams through data-based recommendations.




Qualifications




What you will need to succeed:




Fluent in git (version control, pre-commit tools), SQL, Python, PySpark syntaxis.
Experience writing tests (Pytest) with Python.
5+ years’ experience in ETL and/or data wrangling techniques.
5+ years’ experience in Statistical/ML techniques to solve supervised (regression, classification) and unsupervised problems.
Experience working with Time Series Data.
Experience in developing business problem using Databricks.
Building Docker images.
Experience with Bayesian methods.
Experience with distributed machine learning
Experience with cloud services
Comfortable with Python tooling (building CI / CD pipelines, configurations, …)
Business storytelling and communicating data insights in business consumable format. Fluent in one Visualization tool (preferable PowerBi).
Strong communications and organizational skills with the ability to deal with ambiguity while juggling multiple priorities
Experience with Agile methodology for team work and analytics ‘product’ creation. Fluent in Azure Boards and Wiki.
Experiences with Deep Learning are a plus.
Experience in Reinforcement Learning is a plus.
Experience in Simulation and Optimization problems in any space is a plus.
Experience with Causal inference is a plus.
Experience with NLP is a plus.
Experience with working with FAIR data is a plus.
Experience with Responsible AI is a plus.




What makes us different?




Hybrid work model & collaborative office experience to enable innovation
Entrepreneurial environment in leading international company
Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities
Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
Volunteering opportunities to help external communities
Diverse team from over 25 countries
Have a stake in D&I strategy and Bring your whole self to work




About PepsiCo




We believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo. We operate with start-up mindset – agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.




PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization – a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PO5CdBmWjUY




So, if you’re ready to be a part of a playground for those who think big, we’d love to chat.




 We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability

PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization – a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PO5CdBmWjUY

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Location : Barcelona




City : Barcelona




State : Barcelona (ES-B)




Country : Spain (ES)




Requisition Number : 25555




Bunge has an exciting opportunity available for a Data Scientist. In this role you will be part of a global team working on challenging, meaningful projects impacting core business activities.




Since 1818, Bunge has been connecting farmers to consumers to deliver essential food, feed, and fuel to the world. Looking to the future, our ambition is to continuously reinvent ourselves, leveraging data to be at the forefront of analytics, technology and talent to accomplish our purpose in a better, faster and simpler way. Bunge is committed to operating and thriving in the digital world – creating world class agile teams where teammates are empowered and encouraged to collaborate and test and learn to succeed.




At Bunge, people don’t just come here to work, they come here to grow – solving challenges that directly impact the world with a diverse team of thinkers and doers. Bunge offers a strong compensation and benefits package, generous paid time off program, flexible work arrangements, and opportunity to progress. Our hybrid work environment provides a balance of in office and remote work.




Most importantly, in all we do we live our values:




Act as One Team by fostering inclusion, collaboration, and respect
Drive for Excellence by being agile, innovative and efficient
Do What's Right by acting safely, ethically, and sustainably




Overview:




The Data Scientist applies strong expertise in machine learning, data mining, and information retrieval to design, prototype, and build next generation advanced analytics engine and services. The data scientist collaborates with translators to define technical problem statement and hypothesis to test; develops efficient and accurate analytical models that mimic business decisions




Responsibilities:




Design, create, test and implement complex models and algorithms that drive analytical solutions throughout the organization
Conduct advanced statistical and other analysis to provide actionable insights, identify trends, and measure performance.
Collaborate with translators and understands business problems to implement scalable and sustainable solutions
Coordinate with MIS, Digital Specialists, and Data Engineers to deliver holistic analytical solutions
Support translators in communicating the design, functioning and output of the analytical models/solutions developed
Ensure timely analysis and testing for regular maintenance of solutions over time




Qualifications/Requirements:




MS/PhD(Computer Science or Electronics), or MS in Computer Applications, Economics, Statistics or Mathematics or related technical discipline
2-3 years’ experience in a statistical and/or data science / business intelligence role
Should have experience in machine learning, statistics, optimization or related fields; deeper experience in working with large data sets, simulation/ optimization or distributed computing tools is a plus
Experience with programming is required; specific experience in R or Python is a plus
Experience of working with large data sets, simulation/ optimization and distributed computing tools (Map/Reduce, Hadoop,
Hive, Spark, etc.) is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong understanding of Agile methodologies
Openness to working in Agile environments with multiple stakeholders
Professional attitude and service orientation; team player
Good verbal and written communication skills
Quick learner to business needs and translate them into potential analytics solutions
Strong work ethic; ability to work at an abstract level and gain consensus
Able to build a sense of trust and rapport that creates a comfortable and effective workplace Attitude to thrive in a fast-paced environment
Open minded to new approaches of learning




Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.




Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or military or veteran status, or any other legally protected status. Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

Title: Mobile Developer (Programa Investigo - Agaur)
Description:
Urbiotica




With more than 50.000 sensors deployed worldwide, Urbiotica is leading the smart parking industry and is considered as a pioneer of the Internet of Things fast growing sector. Thanks to its end-2-end solutions for Smart Cities, Urbiotica participates actively in the transformation of the urban areas, creating a more digital and sustainable environment for the citizens.  We would like to integrate a Mobile Developer to join our SW team to develop our Mobile applications.  

 

About the Team  

Our young multicultural and multidisciplinary team is the base of our successes. The work environment and the company values allow all employees to blossom and grow in this exciting entrepreneurial project, launched more than 10 years ago in Barcelona. 




About SW Department 

The software department focuses on managing data send from different types of Hardware and Software sensors in order to extract and generate valuable information for both customers and support/hardware internal teams. We develop different software at all stages of IoT data flow, from data streaming to batch processing, machine learning, AI or visualization tools (Web/apps). 

 

Tech stack 

Our frontend team develops in Flutter for iOS and Android mobile and React and Typescript for Web development. The backend team writes Java and Python to build different software for sensor data streaming, APIs and integrations with 3rd parties. The Datascience team uses Apache Spark and Pandas to process big quantity of data in batch processing and machine learning and IA algorithms to implement sensor detection (both from hardware or software sensors). In order to store all IoT data and then perform multiple analysis over them, we use as a storage layer multiple databases such as SQL (PostgreSQL), non-SQL (HBase) and In-Memory (Redis). Finally, softwares are deployed as microservices in Kubernetes cluster on AWS or On-Premises infrastructures.  

 

Your role 

Within the software development team for mobile applications, you will develop tools that support the research of technologies used in departments that develop IoT sensors. 

You will develop tools for communicating with the devices, configuring them, analyzing the information sent by the sensor and finally displaying all the data on the same mobile device, since the sensors are installed in cities and have a tool that allows you to have sensor information at the moment and quickly facilitates the research of the development team. 




Key Responsibilities 

Develop and maintain mobile applications used to manage and visualize data from IoT sensors 
Develop and maintain mobile application used to configure sensors 
Write production-ready, supportable code 
Self-test your code (Make sure it works!) 




Requirements 

Higher Education Degree 
Interest in mobile technologies and frameworks 
Knowledge of Flutter 
Experience with code versioning (Git) 
Strong sense of responsibility, communication and teamwork skills, willingness to learn 
Experience working with APIs 

 

Nice to have 

Knowledge of Dockers 

 

What we offer 

Indefinite contract 
Ability to learn and grow up as a software engineer 
50% remote time (offices are in Barcelona and there is the possibility to go when you want at the office) 
Working in a young, dynamic and technological environment with years of IoT experience 

 

 

Programa Investigo, finançat per la Unió Europea, Next Generation EU 







Show more Show less

  • Experience with code versioning (Git) 
  • Strong sense of responsibility, communication and teamwork skills, willingness to learn 
  • Experience working with APIs 

 

Nice to have 

  • Knowledge of Dockers 

 

What we offer 

  • Indefinite contract 
  • Ability to learn and grow up as a software engineer 
  • 50% remote time (offices are in Barcelona and there is the possibility to go when you want at the office) 
  • Working in a young, dynamic and technological environment with years of IoT experience 

 

 

Programa Investigo, finançat per la Unió Europea, Next Generation EU

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
En The Predictive Company, estamos en proceso de fortalecer nuestro equipo y nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un perfil técnico con sólidos conocimientos en el área de informática y tecnologías de la información. 

 

Estamos en la búsqueda de un individuo altamente proactivo, responsable y resolutivo, capaz de aprender de manera autónoma y de desarrollar proyectos de manera independiente. La persona que buscamos debe sentirse motivada para liderar un proyecto prácticamente desde sus inicios y poseer el firme compromiso de realizar las tareas de forma óptima y con la mayor calidad posible. Además, valoramos su disposición para documentar el proceso con gran detalle y precisión, lo que permitirá garantizar la continuidad del proyecto a largo plazo. 

 

Si en este momento estás buscando un nuevo desafío en el área de informática y te interesa trabajar en el desarrollo de soluciones SaaS enfocadas en la eficiencia energética, esta es una oportunidad que no puedes dejar pasar. Somos una Start-up en plena fase de expansión y nos encantaría contar contigo para seguir creciendo y alcanzando nuestros objetivos. 

 




Tareas:




Automatización de procesos de adquisición de datos con Python mediante protocolos industriales (BACnet, OPC, Modbus, etc.). 
Creación y mantenimiento de bases de datos de series temporales (InfluxDB, AWS Timestream). 
Creación y administración de servidores (instancias EC2) en la nube de AWS  
soporte en la innovación y desarrollo de otros procesos involucrados en la solución. 
Gestión y organización de proyectos. 
Encargado de mantener relaciones con los equipos técnicos de los clientes.  




¿Qué ofecemos?




Flexibilidad en cuanto a horarios y política de trabajo remoto.  
Oportunidad de crecer profesionalmente. Podrás desarrollar nuevas habilidades y asumir nuevas responsabilidades. 
Integración en un equipo multidisciplinar. 
Disposición de medidas de conciliación de la vida personal y profesional. 




Requisitos:




Estudios mínimos: 

Cursando el último año/Graduado en Ingeniería o Máster en áreas de informática, industriales, telecomunicaciones o similar. 

FP Superior en informática con Experiencia Laboral. 




Valoramos positivamente: 

Nivel avanzado de programación en Python. 
Experiencia en administración de sistemas. 
Creación y mantenimiento de máquinas virtuales/servidores. 
Servicios en la nube AWS. 
Creación y gestión de bases de datos. 
Conocimientos o interés en eficiencia energética y sistemas de climatización. 
Familiaridad en el uso y diseño de contenedores Docker o soluciones similares.  
Familiaridad con procesos CI/CD y metodologías y herramientas devOps. 
Formación y/o experiencia en gestión de proyectos. 

Idiomas: 

Idiomas: inglés técnico (min B2) y castellano/catalán fluido.

Title: Ingeniero desarrollo software - backend
Description:
SAYME es un proveedor líder de soluciones tecnológicas IoT para Smart Cities Industria 4.0 Logística y Gestión del Cliente.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

Un entorno de trabajo acogedor y agradable en el que desarrollarse profesionalmente.

Un equipo joven comprometido con el proyecto.

La oportunidad de trabajar en uno de los segmentos de tecnología con más previsión de crecimiento.

Una empresa en expansión con un ambicioso plan de expansión que ya cuenta con clientes repartidos por todo el mundo.

El candidato ideal será formará parte del equipo de desarrollo participará en el desarrollo de backend y dará soporte de ingeniería en la ejecución de los proyectos.

Funciones principales

Diseño y desarrollo de backend y servicios web y REST
Modelado y diseño de estructuras de datos relacionales y no relacionales
Desarrollo de servicios y mantenimiento de sistemas Linux y LAMP
Elaboración de documentación técnica
Desarrollo de test unitarios y de conjunto
Gestión de proyectos basados en soluciones IoT

Requisitos

Ingeniería/Grado en informática telecomunicaciones o similar
Conocimiento y experiencia en manejo de lenguajes de programación PHP Python HTML Javascript
Experiencia en desarrollo de consultas complejas SQL
Manejo y administración MySQL
Nivel de Ingles medio

Se valorará

Conocimiento y/o experiencia en motores de datos no relacionales
Conocimiento de administración y uso de servicios de Microsoft Azure
Experiencia en administración y mantenimiento de bases de datos de grandes dimensiones
Experiencia en herramientas de Big Data

Otros requisitos

Buena actitud
Capacidad de aprendizaje
Capacidad de trabajar en grupo con metodologías Agile

PHP, Python, HTML, Javascript, SQL, MySQL, REST, Linux, LAMP, IoT, Azure,

Title: Software Engineer (Hybrid Remote)
Description:
NPAW is the leading video intelligence company helping online streaming services grow. A global pioneer in its space, NPAW has over a decade of experience developing ground-breaking, scalable analytics solutions to optimize performance and user engagement, to build media experiences that maximize revenue.

Its Suite of analytics apps provides advanced visibility of platform performance, audience behavior, advertising and content efficiency, and app navigation in real-time to support data-driven decisions. NPAW serves more than 150 video services and processes, with over 100 billion plays per year worldwide. Established in 2008 by co-founders of the video streaming service Rakuten TV, NPAW has offices in Barcelona and New York with teams around the world. For more information, visit https://npaw.com.

Responsibilities
Building tools and software developed in Java that enables the creation and evolution of different products which allow our clients to understand users' behavior.
Optimization of existing services
Working along with our different departments to develop groundbreaking technology:
Collaborating with the Product Team to create and develop new metrics to make valuable contributions to our Analytics Software.
Cooperating with the UI department to offer a great data visualization experience.
Collaborating with the Customer Engineering and Operations teams to plan the different custom development projects cycles and deliverables.
Crafting new functionalities able to process and analyze high volumes of data.

Requirements

Experience in projects as a back-end developer and using Java.
Experience working with local and distributed cache libraries to improve performance.
Experience ensuring APIs are always reachable, scalable, and capable of processing permanent high volumes of data.
Experience in service optimization.
Knowledge of Git version control system, and automation tools such as Jenkins or TeamCity.
Passionate about programming, always looking for solutions to solve engineering problems.
Not afraid of learning new things such as other programming languages, different technologies.
Dedicated and used to tight deadlines.
Can do attitude, commitment and pride in what you do.

Benefits
Competitive salary 💰
Permanent contract 📄
Flexible compensation plan 📊
Restaurant 🍽
Transport 🚊
Nursery 👶🏽
Health insurance 🩺
Hybrid remote-office work 🏡
Flexible work schedule ⏰
23 days of holidays per year 🌴
Birthday afternoon off 🎂
Career growth opportunities 🚀
Access to continuous training 💻
Language lessons 👩🏽‍🏫
Referral bonus 🤝
International & multicultural team (more than 20 nationalities!) 🌍
Fun environment: volunteering, company events, BBQs, pizza days, etc. 🎉
A great office based in Barcelona 🏢
Free lunch at the office 🥗🍕
Free drinks, fruit & snacks ☕️🍺 🍎 🍪
An amazing technological challenge 🧑🏽‍💻

Follow us on Linkedin and Twitter to see what we are up to, or have a look at Instagram to see what it's like to work at NPAW!

We celebrate the diversity, and we want our employees to reflect those differences. At NPAW, we’re committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
Show more Show less

Title: Python AWS Developer
Description:
Our opportunity

LiveWell by Zurich is a digital, health and wellbeing solution designed to engage and support corporates, employees and individuals on their health journey. We operate in global and local markets with the key mission of creating healthier, happier lives. Zurich LiveWell Services and Solutions Ltd (“Zurich LiveWell”) takes a holistic approach to health and wellbeing across physical, mental, financial and social health because all these areas need to be in balance to drive optimal performance.

Our aim is to empower individuals to own their total health and wellbeing through health education, best-practice prevention focused on lifestyle activities, goal setting, health challenges and responsive health services such as telemedicine.

Your role

In this role you work as a Python Developer in one of our Squads with PO, UX/UI, other Flutter Developer and Backend Developers to build features for our LiveWell proposition. You will work on our AWS code written in Python.

Each Squad consists of a Product Owner (PO), UX/UI Designers, Frontend and Backend Developers, and QA.

As a Phyton AWS Developer your main responsibilities will involve


Develop Python code for AWS services
Testing of developed features
Unit tests of developed features
Manage tasks on DevOps sprint boards


Your Skills And Experience

As a Phyton AWS Developer your skills and qualifications will ideally include:


Proven record in building Python code for AWS services
API documentation frameworks (Swagger, RAML, OpenAPI spec)
Dynamodb, SNS, SQS, Lambda, Appsync, Apigateway, Aurora (Postgresql), s3,
Essential experience is working in a multicultural environment
Being able to communicate in English with fluency


Additional Information

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:


Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 80%
Flexible working hours
Wide range of internal and external trainings
Free English, German and Spanish classes depending on the needs
Ticket restaurant
Life and Health Insurance
Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company
Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you
Special banking and insurance conditions
Exclusive Employees discounts


Primary work location is Barcelona, Poblenou. Please apply with your CV in English and portfolio by clicking on the button “Apply online”.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

Why Zurich

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We are an equal opportunity employer who knows that each employee is unique - that’s what makes our team so great!

Join us as we constantly explore new ways to protect our customers and the planet .


Location(s): ES - Barcelona
Remote working: No
Schedule: Full Time
Recruiter name: Malgorzata Ewa Zalewska
Show more Show less
