Title: Growth Engineer
Description:
We started Amenitiz to make technology accessible to independent hoteliers all over the world - whether they are in the heart of Paris or the Uyuni Salt Flats in Bolivia.

At Amenitiz, you’ll be working with us toward our shared vision to bring knowledge and innovation to the hospitality industry. We are committed to empowering independent hoteliers and helping them focus on what matters the most to them: crafting fantastic experiences for their guests.

Backed by some of Europe's leading investors, Amenitiz is one of the fastest-growing companies in Europe. We welcome amazing talent to join us on our mission of transforming the industry and growing while having fun!

Sounds fantastic, but why Amenitiz?

We Are Building a Great Product

Managing and streamlining processes in the hospitality industry can be challenging for independent hoteliers, especially when it comes to handling reservations (overbookings) and reducing online travel agencies (OTAs) fees.

We’ve built an all-in-one platform that provides property owners with everything they need to attract guests, handle bookings, grow revenue, and craft exceptional guest experiences in the most simple and easy way you can imagine.

Our Great Team Is Waiting For You

We are starting 2023 with +250 team members, we foster a culture of positive vibes, empowering each team member to discover their true potential. Within Amenitiz you'll find a group of passionate, friendly, and ready-to-take-ownership people, who deliver a committed working environment.

We endeavor to bring our best every day, leading with kindness, and building a client-first culture of success. We are ready to roll up our sleeves and leave the place better than we found it.

Ready to face new challenges?

Growing fast means more opportunities for everyone. Amenitiz has ambitious expansion plans while striving for operational excellence: this could be opening to new markets, launching new features, building unique business functions, and so much more.

Our software is trusted by over 6,000 hoteliers in more than 37 countries — and this is growing fast! That's millions of bookings a year and countless people working behind the scenes to improve the life of hoteliers and guest experiences. Bring your best and enjoy the ride!

About The Role

As Growth Engineer in Amenitiz you have will have the full technical ownership of the marketing website to turn it into a top lead generation machine; you will gradually enable a strong Product Led Growth motion with many leads entering our funnel through our self-service flow and you will be an important link between Product and Sales departments.

What You’ll Achieve

Drive technical onboarding and implementation for a product that solves real problems to hoteliers: driving bookings, managing reservations, finances, staff, and payments!
Help build the foundations of Product Led Growth (PLG) at Amenitiz - As an early member of our PLG team, you'll be instrumental in helping define our product-led sales motions.
Meaningfully shape our future product: as you engage with leads and customers, you'll gain insights to help us serve them better — and work with the product team to inform what we do next.
Elevate your skills as we tackle our most impactful challenges: We've grown faster than any other Hospitech company connecting hoteliers to our sales professionals before buying — there's so much more to achieve by opening our product up to every hotelier in the world!


What You Will Be Involved Into

Build technical proof of concepts, demos, or tools to assist pre-sales with providing value to customers;
Solving issues with the existing systems, prioritising based on business and technical needs and communicating impact to the team;
Accompany our growth by redesigning and continuously developing the website, in close collaboration with the acquisition team;
Ensure the quality and stability of web acquisition products (marketing website and blog);
Implement no-code solutions where appropriate to streamline the Growth team's ability to ship tests;
Own A/B testing stack and strategy;


Skills You Bring

Soft Skills

You are a self-starter who is great at solving problems, initiating discussions, who is solutions-oriented, customer focused and which believes that any challenge can be scaled with the right mindset and tools.
You have a growth mindset and thrive in the building stage of a nascent team.
You’re highly adaptable, easily acclimating to a rapidly changing business and industry.


Hard Skills

3 years of experience in JS (fullstack, front-end sensibility);
Knowledgeable about modern web technologies and testing frameworks;
Knowledge of WordPress;
Basic knowledge of technical SEO or willingness to dive in;
Fluent in english;
Excellent analytical skills;
Growth experience is a plus;


Some of our favorite perks include…

Extensive medical, and wellness coverage to ensure you’re feeling great physically and mentally.
We provide Stock Options that ensure you have ownership in our success.
Our beautiful and spacious office is located right in the heart of Barcelona (Ronda de Sant Pere). Daily fruits, Tuesday breakfasts, Thursday after-office, Gym, and everyday sunshine and views at the rooftop.
We do monthly team-building activities. From sailing the Mediterranean Sea and shows like Cirque du Soleil, to poetry, cooking, or magic workshops.
Forget about waiting till the end of the month to get paid. Access your salary any day you want!
Flexible remuneration: enjoy saving on restaurants, kindergarten, transport, and training.
Energetic, fast-growing, and international environment (26+ nationalities).
One of the hottest start-ups in Barcelona, according to the WIRED
Eager to be inspired and learn? We will buy ANY book you want, while also having a deep library with amazing knowledge to trigger your growth.
Positive impact on the world: https://noos.global/en.


With backing from investors such as Eight Roads, Point 9, Chalfen Ventures, Backed & Otium Capital, and having raised a $30M series A, we’re scaling our 6.000 hotelier portfolio, going deep on each of our five main markets, and more than anything, having a ton of fun, creating impact, and learnings along the way.

We created Amenitiz because we believe technology is the key to making success and profitability accessible to every hotelier in the world - whether in the heart of Paris or the Uyuni Salt Flats in Bolivia.

Our mission is to build an all-in-one platform to help owners grow and manage their vacation properties by making attracting guests, managing bookings, and crafting exceptional experiences simple and easy. We invite you to be part of our growing community and help us redefine the future of online hospitality together.
Show more Show less

At Amenitiz, you’ll be working with us toward our shared vision to bring knowledge and innovation to the hospitality industry. We are committed to empowering independent hoteliers and helping them focus on what matters the most to them: crafting fantastic experiences for their guests.

Backed by some of Europe's leading investors, Amenitiz is one of the fastest-growing companies in Europe. We welcome amazing talent to join us on our mission of transforming the industry and growing while having fun!

Sounds fantastic, but why Amenitiz?

Managing and streamlining processes in the hospitality industry can be challenging for independent hoteliers, especially when it comes to handling reservations (overbookings) and reducing online travel agencies (OTAs) fees.

We’ve built an all-in-one platform that provides property owners with everything they need to attract guests, handle bookings, grow revenue, and craft exceptional guest experiences in the most simple and easy way you can imagine.

We are starting 2023 with +250 team members, we foster a culture of positive vibes, empowering each team member to discover their true potential. Within Amenitiz you'll find a group of passionate, friendly, and ready-to-take-ownership people, who deliver a committed working environment.

We endeavor to bring our best every day, leading with kindness, and building a client-first culture of success. We are ready to roll up our sleeves and leave the place better than we found it.

Growing fast means more opportunities for everyone. Amenitiz has ambitious expansion plans while striving for operational excellence: this could be opening to new markets, launching new features, building unique business functions, and so much more.

Our software is trusted by over 6,000 hoteliers in more than 37 countries — and this is growing fast! That's millions of bookings a year and countless people working behind the scenes to improve the life of hoteliers and guest experiences. Bring your best and enjoy the ride!

About The Role

As Growth Engineer in Amenitiz you have will have the full technical ownership of the marketing website to turn it into a top lead generation machine; you will gradually enable a strong Product Led Growth motion with many leads entering our funnel through our self-service flow and you will be an important link between Product and Sales departments.

What You’ll Achieve
  • Drive technical onboarding and implementation for a product that solves real problems to hoteliers: driving bookings, managing reservations, finances, staff, and payments!
  • Help build the foundations of Product Led Growth (PLG) at Amenitiz - As an early member of our PLG team, you'll be instrumental in helping define our product-led sales motions.
  • Meaningfully shape our future product: as you engage with leads and customers, you'll gain insights to help us serve them better — and work with the product team to inform what we do next.
  • Elevate your skills as we tackle our most impactful challenges: We've grown faster than any other Hospitech company connecting hoteliers to our sales professionals before buying — there's so much more to achieve by opening our product up to every hotelier in the world!

What You Will Be Involved Into
  • Build technical proof of concepts, demos, or tools to assist pre-sales with providing value to customers;
  • Solving issues with the existing systems, prioritising based on business and technical needs and communicating impact to the team;
  • Accompany our growth by redesigning and continuously developing the website, in close collaboration with the acquisition team;
  • Ensure the quality and stability of web acquisition products (marketing website and blog);
  • Implement no-code solutions where appropriate to streamline the Growth team's ability to ship tests;
  • Own A/B testing stack and strategy;

Skills You Bring

Soft Skills
  • You are a self-starter who is great at solving problems, initiating discussions, who is solutions-oriented, customer focused and which believes that any challenge can be scaled with the right mindset and tools.
  • You have a growth mindset and thrive in the building stage of a nascent team.
  • You’re highly adaptable, easily acclimating to a rapidly changing business and industry.

Hard Skills
  • 3 years of experience in JS (fullstack, front-end sensibility);
  • Knowledgeable about modern web technologies and testing frameworks;
  • Knowledge of WordPress;
  • Basic knowledge of technical SEO or willingness to dive in;
  • Fluent in english;
  • Excellent analytical skills;
  • Growth experience is a plus;

Some of our favorite perks include…
  • Extensive medical, and wellness coverage to ensure you’re feeling great physically and mentally.
  • We provide Stock Options that ensure you have ownership in our success.
  • Our beautiful and spacious office is located right in the heart of Barcelona (Ronda de Sant Pere). Daily fruits, Tuesday breakfasts, Thursday after-office, Gym, and everyday sunshine and views at the rooftop.
  • We do monthly team-building activities. From sailing the Mediterranean Sea and shows like Cirque du Soleil, to poetry, cooking, or magic workshops.
  • Forget about waiting till the end of the month to get paid. Access your salary any day you want!
  • Flexible remuneration: enjoy saving on restaurants, kindergarten, transport, and training.
  • Energetic, fast-growing, and international environment (26+ nationalities).
  • One of the hottest start-ups in Barcelona, according to the WIRED
  • Eager to be inspired and learn? We will buy ANY book you want, while also having a deep library with amazing knowledge to trigger your growth.
  • Positive impact on the world: https://noos.global/en.

With backing from investors such as Eight Roads, Point 9, Chalfen Ventures, Backed & Otium Capital, and having raised a $30M series A, we’re scaling our 6.000 hotelier portfolio, going deep on each of our five main markets, and more than anything, having a ton of fun, creating impact, and learnings along the way.

We created Amenitiz because we believe technology is the key to making success and profitability accessible to every hotelier in the world - whether in the heart of Paris or the Uyuni Salt Flats in Bolivia.

Our mission is to build an all-in-one platform to help owners grow and manage their vacation properties by making attracting guests, managing bookings, and crafting exceptional experiences simple and easy. We invite you to be part of our growing community and help us redefine the future of online hospitality together.

Title: Python BackEnd Developer | Híbrido | Barcelona
Company: Prometeo Talent | High-quality HR & recruitment services
Description:
Sobre la propuesta:




Buscamos un BackEnd developer que se sume a su equipo. Con experiencia en Python y que participe en la toma de decisiones sobre cómo enfocar las distintas problemáticas y que le guste trabajar en equipos agiles y flexibles. Reportarias a la dirección de I+D con las siguiente funciones:




- Desarrollo, mantenimiento y monitorización de las APIs propias de Indoorclima mediante el uso de FastAPI, SQLAlchemy, MySQL.

- Uso de plataforma de monitorización (Grafana) y recolección de errores (Sentry).

- Seguimiento del ciclo de vida de los modelos de Machine Learning. Almacenamiento, despliegue, pipelines de datos, mantenimiento y monitorización. Mantenimiento del modelo de datos.

- Rediseño e implementación de los algoritmos de control y optimización de SGClima. Tecnologia usadas: Python, Celery, RabbitMQ y Redis.




Serias el perfil ideal si cuentas con:

Almenos 2 años de experiencia trabajando con Python.
Experiencia con FastAPI o Flask
Conocimiento en MySQL y SQLAlchemy
Conocimiento en Celery y Redis, y la realizacion de pipelines.
Experiencia en herramientas de monitorización como Grafana o Sentry.
Ingles técnico (para trabajar con codigo en ingles)




Seria un plus si tambien cuentas con:

Conocimientos de Kubernetes. Ya que la infraestructura esta montada ahi.
Conocimiento en RabbitMQ.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

Contrato indefinido.
Teletrabajo dos días por semana.
Horario flexible.
Ambiente dinámico, fresco y divertido.
Jornada laboral de Lunes a Viernes.

Show more Show less

Title: Software Engineer
Place: Sant Boi de Llobregat, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Company Description

At Frasers Group we’re rethinking retail. Through digital innovation and unique store experiences, we’re serving our consumers with the world’s best sports, premium and luxury brands globally. As a leader in the industry, we’re elevating the retail experience for our consumers through our collection of established brands, including Sports Direct, FLANNELS, USC, Frasers, and GAME.

We present an ideal opportunity for someone who is passionate about technology and wants to deliver the absolute best that they can and keep innovation at the forefront. We have a £5,000 per head annual training budget within IT, as well as bonus schemes including our Frasers Champion where 8 peer nominated winners earn double their monthly salary for their outstanding performance

Job Description

This role is a great opportunity for skilled Engineers who are enthusiastic about delivering quality software to support our large-scale automated logistics operations. You’ll have the opportunity to design, build and support features including state-of-the-art automation that enable our operational teams to deliver exceptional value to our customers within the Frasers Group Brand.

Our Logistics Development team is a strong in-house team who are passionate about delivering quality software to support the growth of our warehouse operations. We’re on a transformational journey to improve our in-house software and develop new features that will continue to drive our rapid expansion. From improvements to picking, packing and loading processes to integrating multi-million-pound warehouse automation, each day will be like no other!

We use a varied development stack within our team and strongly encourage cross-training of the technologies we use. Within your day-to-day role you’ll be working on projects making use of technologies such as Oracle Exadata, SQL Server, .NET Core, WebAPI, Kafka and much more! Our in-house systems make heavy use of our Oracle / SQL so strong database knowledge is a must.

This role is available on a mainly remote basis with office presence required around once per month

Qualifications

3+ years’ experience as a software engineer within an agile development team
Natural problem solver, able to use your own initiative and find creative solutions to complex problems
A thorough understanding of SQL/PL-SQL, either Microsoft SQL Server 2012+ or Oracle PL-SQL
C# / .NET Framework / .NET 6
Experience debugging complicated database procedural logic
Strong database design & implementation
A passion for learning and progressing your technical skills
Comfortable working with stakeholders at all levels gathering information to progress work
Additional Information

To Be Able To Make The Most Of It You Need To Live And Breathe Our Principles

An opportunity like this at Frasers is for the fearless. The potential is massive, the experience unrivalled.

Think without limits and take the team with you
Own it and back yourself
Don 't hesitate and act with purpose
Be commercial and customer-focused.
Show more Show less

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Nuestro cliente es una cooperativa de telecomunicaciones sin ánimo de lucro.

Creen en el consumo responsable y en la transparencia y pedagogía en el cuidado de las personas en las decisiones colectivas y en el trabajo justo e inclusivo como principios fundamentales para avanzar hacia un modelo más justo igualitario y sostenible.

Deseamos personas con mentalidad emprendedora que quieran usar sus talentos para hacer del mundo un lugar mejor. Queremos construir herramientas informáticas que ayuden a escalar proyectos de economía social. Apostamos por el software libre y colaboramos con otras entidades y cooperativas con el objetivo de convertirnos en una herramienta de cambio.

Estamos buscando un/a programador Python con experiencia en el dominio ERP (idealmente Odoo/OpenERP) y experiencia en Django.

Tareas principales

Diseñar y construir módulos dentro del ERP Odoo

Mantenimiento del código desarrollado

Integración entre el ERP y sistemas de terceros

Brindar soporte técnico a las implementaciones de ERP.

Desarrollo web back-end con Django

Nuestro cliente es una cooperativa de telecomunicaciones sin ánimo de lucro.

Creen en el consumo responsable y en la transparencia y pedagogía en el cuidado de las personas en las decisiones colectivas y en el trabajo justo e inclusivo como principios fundamentales para avanzar hacia un modelo más justo igualitario y sostenible.

Deseamos personas con mentalidad emprendedora que quieran usar sus talentos para hacer del mundo un lugar mejor. Queremos construir herramientas informáticas que ayuden a escalar proyectos de economía social. Apostamos por el software libre y colaboramos con otras entidades y cooperativas con el objetivo de convertirnos en una herramienta de cambio.

Estamos buscando un/a programador Python con experiencia en el dominio ERP (idealmente Odoo/OpenERP) y experiencia en Django.

Tareas principales

Diseñar y construir módulos dentro del ERP Odoo

Mantenimiento del código desarrollado

Integración entre el ERP y sistemas de terceros

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Overview




About D+A at PepsiCo




PepsiCo is using the power of data to transform the way our world-famous portfolio of brands is sold every day. Our Data & Analytics organization influences every aspect of how we sell and move our products. In just a short period of time, they’ve built new capabilities that have defined the roadmap across all our brands. Members of our team solve complex problems facing our rapidly changing business and get to see their work come to life in the real world.




DS




Join our Data Science team where you will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where you will be responsible of building deployable statistical/machine learning models, starting from the discovery phase. You will work closely with process owners, product owners and final business users. This will provide you the correct visibility and understanding of criticality of your developments.




Responsibilities




Working with huge and varied datasets to find sources of strategic advantage in go-to-market and execution.
Designing and using algorithms and building predictive & prescriptive models needed to automate execution and the generation of insights, to enable efficiencies that allow colleagues to focus on value added tasks.
Developing our internal capability to derive insights from structured data, unstructured data through location intelligence, machine learning, etc. to unlock new sources of insight that can be used to drive competitive advantage.
Helping to define the technology infrastructure to enhance our data science capabilities enabling advances in our insight capability.
Acting as an “evangelist” for data science within the Advanced Analytics team, building understanding of, and enthusiasm for, what can be achieved.
Develop our existing tools to build greater simulation and forecasting capability, giving our business and our retail customers confidence that we can improve returns on current execution, asset deployment and activation plans.




Qualifications




What you will need to succeed:




3-5 years of relevant advanced analytics experience in Marketing or Commercial in either Retail, or CPG industries. Other B2C domains can be considered
Advanced knowledge of key data science techniques:
Data preparation and feature engineering
Supervised / Unsupervised learning
Location Analytics & Intelligence
High level of proficiency in either R or Python
Familiarity with query languages such as SQL or Hive
Understanding of cloud based data and platforms will be an added bonus
Good to have understanding of agile ways of working
Able to translate complex concepts into clear stories for the business, proven through at least 18 months experience in a business facing data science role
Experience of defining the shape of data science projects from the initial creation of hypotheses through to delivery of results into the business




About PepsiCo




We believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo. We operate with start-up mindset – agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.




PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization – a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PO5CdBmWjUY




We believe in a hybrid working model that allows our employees to be productive and efficient in whatever environment they feel most comfortable in. We are proud to offer a flexible work schedule that allows our employees to work from home, from the office, or from a combination of both. We foster an environment of trust, collaboration and respect, which has enabled us to develop innovative solutions to the challenges that our customers face.




So, if you’re ready to be a part of a playground for those who think big, we’d love to chat.




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, or disability status. We are an inclusive workplace and are committed to promoting diversity and inclusion in all areas of our business.
Show more Show less
HTML:
Overview


About D+A at PepsiCo


PepsiCo is using the power of data to transform the way our world-famous portfolio of brands is sold every day. Our Data & Analytics organization influences every aspect of how we sell and move our products. In just a short period of time, they’ve built new capabilities that have defined the roadmap across all our brands. Members of our team solve complex problems facing our rapidly changing business and get to see their work come to life in the real world.


DS


Join our Data Science team where you will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where you will be responsible of building deployable statistical/machine learning models, starting from the discovery phase. You will work closely with process owners, product owners and final business users. This will provide you the correct visibility and understanding of criticality of your developments.


Responsibilities


  • Working with huge and varied datasets to find sources of strategic advantage in go-to-market and execution.
  • Designing and using algorithms and building predictive & prescriptive models needed to automate execution and the generation of insights, to enable efficiencies that allow colleagues to focus on value added tasks.
  • Developing our internal capability to derive insights from structured data, unstructured data through location intelligence, machine learning, etc. to unlock new sources of insight that can be used to drive competitive advantage.
  • Helping to define the technology infrastructure to enhance our data science capabilities enabling advances in our insight capability.
  • Acting as an “evangelist” for data science within the Advanced Analytics team, building understanding of, and enthusiasm for, what can be achieved.
  • Develop our existing tools to build greater simulation and forecasting capability, giving our business and our retail customers confidence that we can improve returns on current execution, asset deployment and activation plans.


Qualifications


What you will need to succeed:


  • 3-5 years of relevant advanced analytics experience in Marketing or Commercial in either Retail, or CPG industries. Other B2C domains can be considered
  • Advanced knowledge of key data science techniques:
  • Data preparation and feature engineering
  • Supervised / Unsupervised learning
  • Location Analytics & Intelligence
  • High level of proficiency in either R or Python
  • Familiarity with query languages such as SQL or Hive
  • Understanding of cloud based data and platforms will be an added bonus
  • Good to have understanding of agile ways of working
  • Able to translate complex concepts into clear stories for the business, proven through at least 18 months experience in a business facing data science role
  • Experience of defining the shape of data science projects from the initial creation of hypotheses through to delivery of results into the business


About PepsiCo


We believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo. We operate with start-up mindset – agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.


PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization – a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PO5CdBmWjUY


We believe in a hybrid working model that allows our employees to be productive and efficient in whatever environment they feel most comfortable in. We are proud to offer a flexible work schedule that allows our employees to work from home, from the office, or from a combination of both. We foster an environment of trust, collaboration and respect, which has enabled us to develop innovative solutions to the challenges that our customers face.


So, if you’re ready to be a part of a playground for those who think big, we’d love to chat.


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, or disability status. We are an inclusive workplace and are committed to promoting diversity and inclusion in all areas of our business.

Title: Ingeniero de software
Description:
Software Backend Engineer (Java)

Our partner is a leading technology company dedicated to developing B2B API's for the connectivity of customers adhering to its platform, which is a proprietary product (leader in its sector) based on Java, Microservices, RPC (SOAP or REST type communication protocol). The company has technology for connectivity services at the CRS and PMS level, marketing services that use machine learning and rich data to drive high performance marketing campaigns and a content platform that collects, manages and distributes quality content.

This role is in a new team that will deliver cutting edge Java solutions and will be responsible for the technical components for the development, optimisation and user testing for our platform. connectivity.




Main functions:

Development and optimisation of the core technical components.
Implementing your architecture for scalability and quality.
Work with the team, in collaboration with the CTO and customer managers to ensure that features are designed and delivered according to requirements and quality standards.
Proactive to create and maintain the quality and safety of your product through modern testing tools and processes.




Requirements:

Java development experience (minimum 5 years).
Used to work with the Spring suite (Spring Boot, Spring Cloud, Spring Security, Spring Batch...) as well as Mybatis, Hibernate, JPA and opensource tools...
Code version management tools such as Git or SVN.
Experience with unit testing like Junit, EasyMock, Spockframework...
Used to work with compiling code with Maven or Gradle.
Nice to have -> High concurrency and high availability software design and development.




Offer:

Competitive salary (up to 52k) with bonuses and annual reviews.
Health insurance.
Free coffee.
Pension plan.
Transport and restaurant vouchers.
Work from home (only 1 office day per week).
Team work with passionate experts who will share their knowledge and help you develop and grow.
Show more Show less

Title: Data Scientist (ASL)
Description:
About ASL In Nestlé

We are a team of Analytical professionals from many countries and diverse backgrounds, each with unique missions and challenges in the biggest health, nutrition and wellness company of the world. We innovate every day through forward-looking projects to create opportunities for Nestlé’s digital challenges with our consumers, customers and at the workplace. We collaborate with our business partners around the world to deliver standardized, integrated technology products and services to create tangible business value.

In order to complete our Analytics Service Line department, we are currently looking for a

Data Scientist.

Position Snapshot

Location: Nestlé Global Hub in Barcelona, Spain
Permanent Contract
Bachelor’s degree
Fluent English


Position Summary

As a Data Scientist, you will have to solve these business questions across various Nestle Business Entities. You will collaborate with different business users across the enterprise to drive the creation and development of business cases to achieve new insights. Your subject matter expertise with predictive modeling will help you advise stakeholders, users, and super-users alike.

Travel activity is low, depending on the project assigned, averaging at below 10%.

A day in the life of...

Partner with Market functions, Globally and Regionally Managed Businesses, and Above Market entities to build and deliver a portfolio of advanced analytics initiatives
Work closely with Market and Centre Functions, Globally and Regionally Managed Businesses, and Above Market entities to identify and answer business problems/questions using appropriate modeling techniques on available data
Monitor data science trends, identify implications, and proactively build Nestlé capabilities.
Collaborate with other Business Analytics teams and networks to utilize new sources of data, for the purpose of developing insights and applicability across markets
Provide enablement services around predictive, diagnostic, and optimization analytics.
Work with large, complex data sets
Work on difficult, non-routine analysis problems, applying advanced analytical methods as needed


What Will Make You Successful?

Bachelor’s degree or higher (Engineering/ Computer Science /Mathematics/Statistics/ Social Science)
Masters would be good to have (in disciplines like Data Science, Business Administrations, Social Science and Economics)
1-2 years of experience in Analytics embedded in Business organizations
would be good to have excellent hands on experience developing advance predictive models to solve business problems
Experience working in a coding language such as R, SQL, Python or similar language
Ability in Univariate/Multivariate Statistics, Bayesian Statistics, or Simulation Modeling is preferred
Ability on data visualization techniques and experience with software is preferred
You are eager to learn new things and are open to the ever changing needs of the new digital world whatever that may mean over the years to come.
Demonstrates personal commitment to change through actions and words
You communicate effectively with all levels of business and technical professionals in English
Willing to work on a multicultural company with professionals across the world
Show more Show less

Title: Softwareentwickler/In, Informatiker/In
Description:
DevOps, .NET, Informatik, Serviceorientierte Architektur, Infrastructure as Code, Softwareentwicklung, Microsoft SQL Server, C#, Datenbanken, Webservices, Webanwendungen About us ENERTRAG provides all services related to renewable energies. We efficiently bring together electricity, heat and mobility in all areas of life. With over two decades of experience in Europe, our more than 800 employees combine all the competencies required for successful operation and efficient maintenance, citizen-oriented planning, reliable construction of energy plants and grids, and even complete interconnected power plants. We are always one energy ahead - be it in sector coupling, participation models or demand-driven nighttime marking. To strengthen our team in Berlin and Dauerthal, we are looking for you to start as soon as possible as a Senior Software Developer* Full or part time. Your tasks You will develop web applications and apps using C# / .Net as a service-oriented architecture You coordinate requirements with product owners*, account managers*, developers*, testers*, and customers* You develop distributed systems with web services and message brokers You handle the structuring of relational databases such as MS SQL Server as well as time series databases such as InfluxDB You handle DevOps tasks such as security, infrastructure as code, containerization, orchestration. We expect from you You have a successfully completed degree with a major in computer science or a comparable field You have significant professional experience in software development You have a very good command of German and English, both written and spoken You are communicative, an organizational talent and a team player We offer you With us you can expect, in addition to an exciting job, the following benefits: A secure job with future prospects in a steadily growing, international company. KiTa subsidies 30 days paid vacation in the calendar year Access to the private pension plan at Allianz at "major customer conditions" & subsidy from ENERTRAG SE in the amount of the saved social security contributions. A collegial environment and flexible working hours Individual training opportunities Occupational health management and accident insurance Questions about the application? We are available from Monday to Friday in the time from 09:00 to 12:00. Tel: +49 39854 6459-307 or by e-mail to ****** Please upload your application exclusively via our careers page! * With us, your skills and motivation to advance renewable energies with us count - not age, gender, skin color, origin, sexual orientation or religion. ENERTRAG | Human Resources Department Your direct line to us: +49 39854 6459-307 www.enertrag.com

Title: ML Engineering Internship
Description:
Our opportunity

Life is too short to just tick the box. Reimagine the box with Zurich!

We are looking for an ML Engineer Intern to join the Data Science & Engineering team as part of the Data & Business Intelligence (DBI) Solution Delivery & Operations department! This is an exciting opportunity as we offer:


Interesting and challenging tasks in a friendly environment
Significant learning experience: a hands-on introduction to real world machine learning use cases working directly with data scientists, data engineers and management
Opportunities to work on real world ML models, and industrializing both new and existing projects by applying MLOps best practices


During this experience not only you will learn and boost your career but also you will build relationships and have fun with teams all over the world!

With us you will have a real opportunity to make a difference and be part of the team!

Your role

As a ML Engineer Intern, you will assist DBI management, scientists, and engineers with:


Develop scripts to detect data drift, measure model performance, and measure model bias and fairness
Implement generic application for ML model serving and orchestration
Develop blueprints for data science projects to work towards ZeroOps
Write unit, integration, data, model, and performance tests for QA
Create generic CI/CD pipelines that handles a wide range of scenarios
Work with and write tutorials for state-of-the-art technologies
Support senior data scientists in real cloud-based projects (Azure & AWS)


Your Skills And Experience

We would like to give this opportunity to somebody who is :


Studying a degree/master's degree related to science, statistics, computing or technical subjects
Knowledge of programming languages, preferable Python
Experience with DevOps best practices
Fluent in English: B2 at a minimum
Open mind to join a team and work within an international context
Active student status with Spanish University/School is mandatory
University student interested in developing career in tech field
Looking for at least 6 months part-time/internship program
Tech savvy approach
An enthusiastic, capable, curious person craving to learn
A good team player with responsible and can-do attitude
Able to use English for communication with colleague and managers from abroad on daily basis


Additional Information

We offer benefits such as:


Paid Internship
Option to work remotely within Spain
Up to 30 hours weekly with Flexible schedule
LinkedIn and internal training opportunities
Special discounts on different brands and products & great banking and insurance conditions.
Welcome pack that includes amazing gadgets.
A cool workspace with gaming, gym, and fun area!
A variety of clubs for you to get to know your colleagues and have fun, e.g. hiking, skiing, reading and many others!
Free coffee and fruit at the office.


Primary work location is Barcelona Poblenou .

Does it look like you have found your future job? Don’t wait anymore and apply sending your CV in English!

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

Why Zurich

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We are an equal opportunity employer who knows that each employee is unique - that’s what makes our team so great!

Join us as we constantly explore new ways to protect our customers and the planet .


Location(s): ES - Barcelona
Remote working: No
Schedule: Part Time
Recruiter name: Maria Sol Besteiro Cerda

Title: Data Science Internship
Description:
Our opportunity

Life is too short to just tick the box. Reimagine the box with Zurich!

We are looking for an Intern to join the Data and Business Intelligence Studio team! This is an exciting opportunity as we offer:


Interesting and challenging tasks in a friendly environment
Significant learning experiences: a hands-on introduction to real world data analysis working directly with senior management
Opportunities to work on real world data, its processing and analysis


During this experience not only you will learn and boost your career but also you will build relationships and have fun with teams all over the world!

With us you will have a real opportunity to make a difference and be part of the team!

Your role

As a Data Scientist Trainee, you will assist DBI management, scientists and engineers with:


Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data
Shaping and producing project proposals
Running and evaluating quantitative experiments
Development with a variety of languages, platforms and libraries
Supporting internal clients in their use of our analytical applications
Building and nurturing Zurich’s internal communities of data science practitioners


You will be exposed to projects big and small carrying a significant analytics component and spanning diverse areas of machine learning, statistical analysis and software engineering, including but not limited to: text classification, propensity modelling, information extraction, hypothesis testing, good coding practices and MLOps.

Your Skills And Experience

We would like to give this opportunity to somebody who is:


Studying a degree/master's degree related to science, statistics, computing or technical subjects with a strong quantitative component. Knowledge of basic statistics is highly valued.
Familiarity with mainstream ML algorithms, libraries and frameworks is definitely a plus.
Knowledge of programming languages, ideally Python or similar, and of the basic principles of coding, algorithms and data structures.
Fluent in English: B2 at a minimum
Open mind to join a team and work within an international and diverse context.
Active student status with Spanish University/School is mandatory
University student interested in developing career in tech field
Looking for at least 6 months part-time/internship program
Tech savvy approach
An enthusiastic, capable, curious person craving to learn
A good team player with responsible and can-do attitude
Able to use English for communication with colleague and managers from abroad on daily basis


Additional Information

We offer benefits such as:


Paid Internship
Option to work remotely within Spain
Up to 30 hours weekly with Flexible schedule
LinkedIn and internal training opportunities
Special discounts on different brands and products & great banking and insurance conditions.
Welcome pack that includes amazing gadgets.
A cool workspace with gaming, gym, and fun area!
A variety of clubs for you to get to know your colleagues and have fun, e.g. hiking, skiing, reading and many others!
Free coffee and fruit at the office.


Primary work location is Barcelona Poblenou .

Title: Softwareingenieur/In
Description:
Testautomatisierung, Frontend, Software Engineering, Backend, Datenbanken, ISTQB Zertifizierung Join our team at Boerse Stuttgart Group as. Software Engineer (m/f/d) Quality Assurance As Boerse Stuttgart Group, we are the sixth largest exchange group in Europe with strategic pillars in the capital markets business as well as in the digital and crypto business. In the capital markets business, we operate exchanges in Germany, Sweden and Switzerland as well as cats as a European over-the-counter trading network. In addition, the Group includes EUWAX AG, a broker that is active internationally. As a pioneer, we have established Boerse Stuttgart Digital, the largest digital and crypto business of any European exchange group. With solutions for institutional customers in the areas of brokerage, trading and custody, as well as the BISON platform for private investors, Boerse Stuttgart Digital creates reliable, regulated and transparent access to the crypto world. We employ more than 700 people at locations in Stuttgart, Berlin, Stockholm, Zurich and Ljubljana. What awaits you You analyze requirements and develop test concepts for our innovative exchange processes You design and implement automated test scenarios in different environments You perform functional, integration and acceptance testing for our data management and analytics systems You can expect a modern technology stack and individual development opportunities You bring in your expertise in the context of exciting interdisciplinary tasks in projects What we offer you A varied and challenging job Attractive compensation with company pension plan and participation in the company's success Voluntary social benefits such as meal allowance and travel allowance, 30 vacation days (+ 24. / 31.12.) Mobile, location-independent work with flexible working hours in many departments. Diverse opportunities for further education What you bring Completed studies or training in the field of information technology. ISTQB certification is an advantage Hands-on experience in designing and executing backend and frontend tests. Experience in test automation and knowledge in database and CI / CD environment is an advantage Technical affinity for the topics of finance and stock market is an advantage Very good German and good English skills in spoken and written language Get to know us - a workplace in the heart of Stuttgart awaits you. Boerse Stuttgart Group Sound good? We look forward to receiving your application Stuttgart Stock Exchange Group Olinda Lopes Stock Exchange Street 4, 70174 Stuttgart Tel.: +49 711 222 985-503 E-mail: ****** www.boerse-stuttgart.de

Title: Senior AI Scientist - Machine Learning for Biologics Engineering
Description:
Job title: Senior AI Scientist - Machine Learning for Biologics Engineering

Location: Barcelona (Spain), Gaithersburg (US)

Make a more meaningful impact to patients’ lives around the globe

Here you’ll have the opportunity to make a meaningful difference to patients’ lives. With science at its heart, this is the place where breakthroughs born in the lab become transformative medicines – for the world’s most complex diseases. Answer unmet medical needs by pioneering the next wave of science, focusing on outcomes and shaping the patient ecosystem. With our ground-breaking pipeline, the outlook is forward-thinking. Be proud to be part of a place that has achieved so much, yet is still moving forward. There’s no better time to join our global, growing enterprise as we lead the way for healthcare and society

The Center for Artificial Intelligence (CAI) is a lab focused on applying machine learning research to the most challenging problems at AstraZeneca. We innovate together with our leading biologists, chemists, and clinicians to close the gap between today's challenges and the forefront of machine learning.

If you would like to have an impact on transforming patients' lives by accelerating new medicines to patients, this may be the position for you!

What You’ll Do

You will be part of an interdisciplinary team (in partnership with the Biologics Engineering) that is responsible for the discovery and optimization of next generation biological drug candidates for all the key therapy areas across AstraZeneca.

You will be working on the design and development of a cyclic discovery process for biologics engineering based on active learning/optimization/search (machine learning models inform the design of wet-lab experiments, the wet-lab automation generates new high-throughput data that is used for model re-training and update of the hypothesis informing the next design step), as well as development of deep learning algorithms for virtual screening of antibodies (supporting the efforts for in silico lead identification and de novo design of antibodies).

You will design, implement, test, and analyze machine learning algorithms to help contribute to the overall improvement and automation of the pipeline for biologics engineering. You will be required to interact extensively with other teams across the organization, and our academic partners with the goal of delivering products in a timely manner.

It is expected that you will present to various partners, represent us at conferences, and publish your findings in scientific journals or top conferences such as ICML, ICLR, NeurIPS, etc.

Accountabilities


Work efficiently in a team of 3-10 (led by a Senior AI Researcher) to optimally deliver projects using the latest ML methods and modern engineering standard processes.
Work multi-functionally with our partners from Biologics Engineering to develop machine learning methods for the design of antibodies with improved biological activity.
Analyze challenges from the drug development process and provide creative solutions from the fields of representation learning, reinforcement learning, active learning, statistical learning theory, causality, ranking and recommendation.
Remain at the forefront of ML Research by participating in journal clubs, mentoring, contributing publications and personal development projects.


Essential For The Role


PhD degree in computer science, statistics, applied mathematics, or related field
OR MSc and 3 years of experience in developing machine learning models.
Experience with active learning/optimization, graph neural networks, and large language models for proteins/antibodies.
Expertise in developing machine learning methods for antibody design, lead optimization and identification.
Knowledge of computational biology and demonstrated experience of incorporating it into machine learning models. Experience with deep learning methods and their applications to biology.
ML Ops experience: model tracking and governance, multiple models in different production contexts, etc.


Desirable for the role


A research program demonstrated by journal and conference publications in prestigious venues (with at least 1 publication as a leading author). Examples include but are not limited to: NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, JMLR, etc.
Deep understanding of drug development and clinical trial process and data (all phases).
Track record of collaborating successfully with AI engineering teams to deliver complex machine learning models.


Why AstraZeneca?

At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being an excellent Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your ambitious spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare.

Why we love it

If your passion is science and you want to be part of a team that makes a bigger impact on patients’ lives, then there’s no better place to be. Here we truly understand science and apply it every day to strengthen and grow our pipeline.

So, what’s next?


Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you.
Are you ready to bring new ideas and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available and we hope it’s yours.


Where can I find out more?

Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn

Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/

Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en

#DataAI

#DSAI

Title: Application engineering
Place: El Prat de Llobregat, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Giesecke+Devrient is a global company that offers security technologies, both in the physical and digital world. Every day, billions of people benefit from G+D innovations in their personal and business lives. With around 11,600 employees across 32 countries, we develop, manufacture, and distribute products and solutions for the safeguarding of payment processes, identities, connectivity, and data. At G+D Mobile Security, the world leader in secure telecommunications systems via SIM / eSIM, we are looking for an Application Engineer: The Application Engineer job is a technical job to manage day-to-day operations in data centers in all service delivery scenarios, primarily in regards to service requests, changes, incident and problem resolutions, and facilitation of second-line support.Application Engineer works closely with IT Stack, Database Engineers, and development teams in order to grant service running with high performance and improve current processes by participating to new release deployments or implementing automation solutions.

Responsabilities:

Installation and deployment of software applications developed by R&D team from same company to the different environments (test and production)
Automate application installation and process continues improvement by using ansible, Docker and Kubernetes technologies.
Troubleshoot application incidents and coordinate with other teams in case of data base, infrastructure or software issues.
Trigger problem tickets regarding monitoring and event management.
Perform needed or on demand health checks of services/solutions
Provide input regarding future and continuous needs in regards to new investments to maintain existing and future services to Data center Manager.
Meet compliance and information security requirements in Service Operations
Evaluate, improve and add applicable work instructions


Knowledge and skills:

Licensed in IT or equivalent.
Know-how in Linux, Docker, Kubernetes and data bases (Oracle, SQL server)
Technical skillset in the software application area.
Knowledge of ITIL processes and Service Management
Ability to work under pressure
Solution and process improvement oriented mindset
Being an excellent team player
Ability to adapt to changes
Ability to follow given processes, procedures and work instructions
Fluent written and spoken English


What’s great about working with us:

Culture: Join a friendly team with different nationalities.
Open working space with Best-in-class equipment: High performance PC with huge monitors.
Office timetable: M-Th 8.30 – 17.30 and Fri 8.30 – 15.30 (with flexible hours on demand).
Social benefits: Continuous training and coaching, private medical insurance, transport ticket, in-house parking.
Own canteen: take a break with our breakfast and lunch service: chose between a wild range of menus, salad desk and sandwiches service. Nicely prices!
Location: El Prat de Llobregat. Easy communication by public transport o private transport.

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
En The Predictive Company, estamos en proceso de fortalecer nuestro equipo y nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un perfil técnico con sólidos conocimientos en el área de informática y tecnologías de la información. 

 

Estamos en la búsqueda de un individuo altamente proactivo, responsable y resolutivo, capaz de aprender de manera autónoma y de desarrollar proyectos de manera independiente. La persona que buscamos debe sentirse motivada para liderar un proyecto prácticamente desde sus inicios y poseer el firme compromiso de realizar las tareas de forma óptima y con la mayor calidad posible. Además, valoramos su disposición para documentar el proceso con gran detalle y precisión, lo que permitirá garantizar la continuidad del proyecto a largo plazo. 

 

Si en este momento estás buscando un nuevo desafío en el área de informática y te interesa trabajar en el desarrollo de soluciones SaaS enfocadas en la eficiencia energética, esta es una oportunidad que no puedes dejar pasar. Somos una Start-up en plena fase de expansión y nos encantaría contar contigo para seguir creciendo y alcanzando nuestros objetivos. 

 




Tareas:




Automatización de procesos de adquisición de datos con Python mediante protocolos industriales (BACnet, OPC, Modbus, etc.). 
Creación y mantenimiento de bases de datos de series temporales (InfluxDB, AWS Timestream). 
Creación y administración de servidores (instancias EC2) en la nube de AWS  
soporte en la innovación y desarrollo de otros procesos involucrados en la solución. 
Gestión y organización de proyectos. 
Encargado de mantener relaciones con los equipos técnicos de los clientes.  




¿Qué ofecemos?




Flexibilidad en cuanto a horarios y política de trabajo remoto.  
Oportunidad de crecer profesionalmente. Podrás desarrollar nuevas habilidades y asumir nuevas responsabilidades. 
Integración en un equipo multidisciplinar. 
Disposición de medidas de conciliación de la vida personal y profesional. 




Requisitos:




Estudios mínimos: 

Cursando el último año/Graduado en Ingeniería o Máster en áreas de informática, industriales, telecomunicaciones o similar. 

FP Superior en informática con Experiencia Laboral. 




Valoramos positivamente: 

Nivel avanzado de programación en Python. 
Experiencia en administración de sistemas. 
Creación y mantenimiento de máquinas virtuales/servidores. 
Servicios en la nube AWS. 
Creación y gestión de bases de datos. 
Conocimientos o interés en eficiencia energética y sistemas de climatización. 
Familiaridad en el uso y diseño de contenedores Docker o soluciones similares.  
Familiaridad con procesos CI/CD y metodologías y herramientas devOps. 
Formación y/o experiencia en gestión de proyectos. 

Idiomas: 

Idiomas: inglés técnico (min B2) y castellano/catalán fluido. 




Show more Show less
HTML:
En The Predictive Company, estamos en proceso de fortalecer nuestro equipo y nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un perfil técnico con sólidos conocimientos en el área de informática y tecnologías de la información. 

 

Estamos en la búsqueda de un individuo altamente proactivo, responsable y resolutivo, capaz de aprender de manera autónoma y de desarrollar proyectos de manera independiente. La persona que buscamos debe sentirse motivada para liderar un proyecto prácticamente desde sus inicios y poseer el firme compromiso de realizar las tareas de forma óptima y con la mayor calidad posible. Además, valoramos su disposición para documentar el proceso con gran detalle y precisión, lo que permitirá garantizar la continuidad del proyecto a largo plazo. 

 

Si en este momento estás buscando un nuevo desafío en el área de informática y te interesa trabajar en el desarrollo de soluciones SaaS enfocadas en la eficiencia energética, esta es una oportunidad que no puedes dejar pasar. Somos una Start-up en plena fase de expansión y nos encantaría contar contigo para seguir creciendo y alcanzando nuestros objetivos. 

 


Tareas:


  • Automatización de procesos de adquisición de datos con Python mediante protocolos industriales (BACnet, OPC, Modbus, etc.). 
  • Creación y mantenimiento de bases de datos de series temporales (InfluxDB, AWS Timestream). 
  • Creación y administración de servidores (instancias EC2) en la nube de AWS  
  • soporte en la innovación y desarrollo de otros procesos involucrados en la solución. 
  • Gestión y organización de proyectos. 
  • Encargado de mantener relaciones con los equipos técnicos de los clientes.  


¿Qué ofecemos?


  • Flexibilidad en cuanto a horarios y política de trabajo remoto.  
  • Oportunidad de crecer profesionalmente. Podrás desarrollar nuevas habilidades y asumir nuevas responsabilidades. 
  • Integración en un equipo multidisciplinar. 
  • Disposición de medidas de conciliación de la vida personal y profesional. 


Requisitos:


Estudios mínimos: 

Cursando el último año/Graduado en Ingeniería o Máster en áreas de informática, industriales, telecomunicaciones o similar. 

FP Superior en informática con Experiencia Laboral. 


Valoramos positivamente: 

  • Nivel avanzado de programación en Python. 
  • Experiencia en administración de sistemas. 
  • Creación y mantenimiento de máquinas virtuales/servidores. 
  • Servicios en la nube AWS. 
  • Creación y gestión de bases de datos. 
  • Conocimientos o interés en eficiencia energética y sistemas de climatización. 
  • Familiaridad en el uso y diseño de contenedores Docker o soluciones similares.  
  • Familiaridad con procesos CI/CD y metodologías y herramientas devOps. 
  • Formación y/o experiencia en gestión de proyectos. 

Idiomas: 

Idiomas: inglés técnico (min B2) y castellano/catalán fluido.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Overview




Data Science




Join our Data Science team where you will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where you will be responsible of building deployable statistical/machine learning models, starting from the discovery phase. You will work closely with process owners, product owners and final business users. This will provide you the correct visibility and understanding of criticality of your developments.




Your mission




Your role will be to be part of growing team based in Barcelona, to create and support global digital developments for PepsiCo. These developments will be focus on Consumer Analytics and Innovation but with the option in the future to collaborate into other fields such as revenue management, supply chain, manufacturing, logistics.




You will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where you will be responsible of building deployable statistical/machine learning models, starting from the discovery phase. You will work closely with process owners, product owners and final business users. This will provide you the correct visibility and understanding of criticality of your developments.




You will be an internal ambassador of the team’s culture around data and analytics. You will provide stewardship to colleagues in the areas that you are an specialist or you are specializing.




Responsibilities




Your day to day with us:




Active contributor to code development in projects and services
Act as contributor in innovation activities
Partner with data engineers to ensure data access for discovery and proper data is prepared for model consumption.
Partner with ML engineers working on industrialization.
Occasionally, coordinate work activities with Business teams, other IT services and as required.
Communicate with business stakeholders in the process of service design, training and knowledge transfer.
Support large-scale experimentation and build data-driven models.
Set KPIs and metrics to evaluate analytics solution given a particular use case.
Refine requirements into modelling problems.
Influence product teams through data-based recommendations.
Research in state-of-the-art methodologies.
Create documentation for learnings and knowledge transfer.
Create reusable packages or libraries.




Qualifications




What will you need to succeed?




6+ years’ experience building solutions in the commercial or in the supply chain space.
6+ years working in a team to deliver production level analytic solutions. Fluent in git (version control). Understanding of Jenkins, Docker are a plus.
6+ years’ experience in ETL and/or data wrangling Fluent in SQL syntaxis.
6+ years’ experience in Statistical/ML techniques to solve supervised (regression, classification) and unsupervised problems. Experiences with Deep Learning are a plus.
6+ years’ experience in developing business problem related statistical/ML modeling with industry tools with primary focus on Python or Scala development.
Business storytelling and communicating data insights in business consumable format. Fluent in one Visualization tool.
Strong communications and organizational skills with the ability to deal with ambiguity while juggling multiple priorities
Experience with Agile methodology for team work and analytics ‘product’ creation. Fluent in Jira, Confluence.
Experience with Azure cloud services is a must.
Experience in Reinforcement Learning is a plus.
Experience in Simulation and Optimization problems in any space is a plus.
Experience with Bayesian methods is a plus.
Experience with Causal inference is a plus.
Experience with NLP is a plus.
Experience with working with FAIR data is a plus.
Experience with Responsible AI is a plus.
Experience with distributed machine learning is a plus




What makes us different?




Hybrid working model: combination of remote and collaborative office experience to enable innovation
Flexible work schedule
Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities
Volunteering opportunities to help external communities
Space to be you to promote our Diversity & Inclusion strategy




About PepsiCo




We believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo. We operate with start-up mindset – agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.




PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization – a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PO5CdBmWjUY




So, if you’re ready to be a part of a playground for those who think big, we’d love to chat.




 We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability

Overview


Data Science


Join our Data Science team where you will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where you will be responsible of building deployable statistical/machine learning models, starting from the discovery phase. You will work closely with process owners, product owners and final business users. This will provide you the correct visibility and understanding of criticality of your developments.


Your mission


Your role will be to be part of growing team based in Barcelona, to create and support global digital developments for PepsiCo. These developments will be focus on Consumer Analytics and Innovation but with the option in the future to collaborate into other fields such as revenue management, supply chain, manufacturing, logistics.


You will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where you will be responsible of building deployable statistical/machine learning models, starting from the discovery phase. You will work closely with process owners, product owners and final business users. This will provide you the correct visibility and understanding of criticality of your developments.


You will be an internal ambassador of the team’s culture around data and analytics. You will provide stewardship to colleagues in the areas that you are an specialist or you are specializing.


Responsibilities


Your day to day with us:


  • Active contributor to code development in projects and services
  • Act as contributor in innovation activities
  • Partner with data engineers to ensure data access for discovery and proper data is prepared for model consumption.
  • Partner with ML engineers working on industrialization.
  • Occasionally, coordinate work activities with Business teams, other IT services and as required.

  • Support large-scale experimentation and build data-driven models.

  • Refine requirements into modelling problems.
  • Influence product teams through data-based recommendations.
  • Research in state-of-the-art methodologies.

Qualifications


What will you need to succeed?


  • 6+ years’ experience building solutions in the commercial or in the supply chain space.
  • 6+ years working in a team to deliver production level analytic solutions. Fluent in git (version control). Understanding of Jenkins, Docker are a plus.
  • 6+ years’ experience in ETL and/or data wrangling Fluent in SQL syntaxis.
  • 6+ years’ experience in Statistical/ML techniques to solve supervised (regression, classification) and unsupervised problems. Experiences with Deep Learning are a plus.

  • Business storytelling and communicating data insights in business consumable format. Fluent in one Visualization tool.

What makes us different?


  • Hybrid working model: combination of remote and collaborative office experience to enable innovation
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
  • Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities
  • Volunteering opportunities to help external communities
  • Space to be you to promote our Diversity & Inclusion strategy


About PepsiCo


We believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo. We operate with start-up mindset – agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.


PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization – a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PO5CdBmWjUY


So, if you’re ready to be a part of a playground for those who think big, we’d love to chat.


  •  We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability

Title: Solutions Engineer
Description:
About Us

AfterShip is an automation platform that empowers eCommerce retailers to create and manage the world's best online shopping experiences. Powering the tracking of over 4.4billion order shipments for 14,000 eCommerce retailers like Amazon, Harry's and Kylie Cosmetics, AfterShip is the one-stop shop for eCommerce tools that support website pop-ups, advanced email flows, page building, shipment visibility, branded shipment tracking, proactive email and SMS notifications, returns, and exchanges.

Our strong product market fit, prioritizing solving real problems for our customers, has resulted in a strong growth trajectory for the company. We secured a 66 million dollar Series B in 2021.

At AfterShip, we are building a diverse and high-performing culture that encourages collaboration and experimentation on a global scale. Even as a company with over 10 years under our belt and 450 AfterShippers across our 8 global offices, we embrace a dynamic and agile approach to our work.

We operate with a flat team structure, where you will have opportunities to contribute your ideas and take ownership over your work to create meaningful impact for the business and the customers we serve. If you're looking for a vehicle to achieve your professional goals and work alongside fantastic teams, we invite you to join us.

Your Mission:

The Solutions Engineer is part of the rapidly growing AfterShip sales organization. The primary goal of this role is to successfully increase the sales and adoption of the AfterShip solutions by working alongside the Account Executives to effectively demonstrate AfterShip's offerings to and answer technical questions for enterprise-level corporate prospects. This Solutions Engineer will work closely with the Sales and Customer Success teams to ensure the prospective client understands what they are purchasing and, upon contract signatures, experiences a seamless onboarding experience.

What You'll Do:

Work with the Account Executives to consultatively engage with prospective clients to identify and develop solutions that meet their needs
Define project scope based on the prospect's needs and requirements
Deliver product POC and demonstrations that are tailored to the prospect's technical requirements and audience
Work to ensure the total buy-in of the AfterShip platform and capabilities by the prospect's development team
Providing customer training to set them up for success with AfterShip's solutions
Ensure completion of projects on-time and on-budget


Who We're Looking For:

A Bachelor's degree is required, preferably in a technical field
Excellent presentation and communication skills
Have customer-facing consulting experience in software implementation and service deployment
Self-motivated to dig in to learn about products, technology, customers and competitors
Familiarity with eCommerce platforms (e.g. Shopify, Magento, BigCommerce)
Knowledge of APIs and previous exposure to programming languages like Go, Node.js, Java, React, and TypeScript – You won't need to write code, but you will need to be able to effectively collaborate between our clients and our Product and Engineering teams
Strong project management and resource management skills
Ability to manage numerous projects simultaneously and work well under deadlines


At AfterShip, we understand that not all applicants will have skills that match the job description exactly. We value diverse experiences and respect that experience comes in many different forms, so even if you feel you may not meet every qualification to a T then we still encourage you to apply. We are always looking for people who can help us continue to raise the bar for our team and who want to join us on our mission.

Why You Should Join Us:

We are super proud of our diverse and geeky culture, started by our software engineer turned CEO and cultivated by a group of amazing people from all over the world. You'll be part of a solutions-oriented team that puts egos aside to achieve new milestones and tackle challenges together.
We're a remote-first team, meaning by default that employees work from home or on a hybrid-flexible basis in our hub locations (Toronto, Austin, Barcelona). You're empowered to choose a work setup that works best for you and your team. With flexible hours depending on your time zone, you'll be able to have a schedule that fits your working style and the requirements of your role.
We have great ambition to make buying and selling easier for everyone in this world -- one of the most exciting spaces for a technology start-up to be in. There is virtually no ceiling for either what you will be doing or learning here, and we want to support you to grow exponentially, along with the company.


Perks:

Competitive compensation
Remote-first/hybrid-flexible work setups
Healthcare coverage offered from day 1
Career progression & professional development
Flexible PTO policy
Invest in your learning + monthly book perk
In-office lunch and commuter benefits for those located in our hub locations


We are an equal opportunity employer. In addition, we are committed to providing accommodations for applicants upon request at any stage of the recruitment process in accordance with the legislative requirements of this job's location. Please let us know if you require accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

Perks:

  • In-office lunch and commuter benefits for those located in our hub locations

We are an equal opportunity employer.
