Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist – Defense & Intelligence




Home Office: Springfield, VA




Clearance Required: Top Secret




People Centered. Data Driven




Elder Research Inc. is a Data Science, AI and Machine Learning consulting firm specialized in providing analytic solutions to clients in Commercial and Government industries. Providing analytic solutions to hundreds of companies across numerous industries, our team enjoys a great variety in the type of work they do and exposure to a wide range of techniques and tools.




We are trusted advisors to our clients, building lasting relationships and partnering as preferred analytics providers. We use a variety of programming languages and tools to create analytic solutions, often fitting within our clients’ environment and needs.




Join our team and find great opportunities to hone your analytic skills, work on complex problems with amazing teammates, and gain valuable analytics consulting experience.




Summary Of Position




We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our team! Ideally, this candidate would have technical leadership experience “solutioning”. In this role, you will work directly with clients, managers, and technical staff to understand business needs, develop technical plans, and deliver data-driven analytical solutions that solve client problems. You will primarily create and deploy predictive models from a wide variety of data sources and types using the latest analytical methods.




Essential Functions




Experience with data solution pipeline: ongoing efforts to find gaps in program capabilities, design and implement technical solutions that create value for the customer.
Experience experimenting with modeling approaches to assess suitability given set of business constraints, available data, and project timeline.
Advise on how to mature and grow technical approaches for large data science program.
Interest in keeping up to date with applied research to know what is possible and what we can apply for customer.
Ability to work independently and collaborate in a dynamic, cross-functional environment.
Experience communicating technical results to clients with varying levels of analytic sophistication.




Other Qualifications




A current TS/SCI active within the past 2 years
Experience with data wrangling of large datasets using commercial or open-source data science tools and big data frameworks such as Apache Spark.
Experience with NLP and/or graph analytics preferred but not required.
Proficient in writing reusable code in Python and SQL to refine through code review and discussion
BS or MS in Operation Research, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, or related fields preferred but not required.
3+ years of experience in Data Science role.




About Elder Research, Inc




Elder Research is a fast-growing consulting firm specializing in predictive analytics. Being in the data mining business over 20 years, we pride ourselves in our ability to find creative, cutting-edge solutions to real-world problems. We work hard to provide the best value to our clients and allow each person to contribute their ideas and put their skills to use immediately.




Our team members are passionate, curious, life-long learners. We value humility, servant-leadership, teamwork, and integrity. We seek to serve our clients and our teammates to the best of our abilities. In keeping with our entrepreneurial spirit, we want candidates who are self-motivated with an innate curiosity and strong teamwork.




Elder Research believes in continuous learning; each week the entire company attends a “Tech Talk” followed by an office lunch. Elder Research provides a supportive work environment with established parental, bereavement, and PTO policies. By prioritizing a healthy work-life balance - with reasonable hours, solid pay, low travel, and extremely flexible time off - Elder Research enables and encourages its employees to serve others.




Elder Research, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.




Elder Research is a Government contractor and our positions require US Citizenship.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you looking for a real career? One in which you can build relationships, work with an exceptional team of fun and friendly customer service professionals, and truly make a difference every day? Then we’re looking for you too!

Moneytree is a family-run business that has been providing financial services to Customers for more than 35 years. Today, we employ 600 Team Members and operate retail locations throughout Southern California, Colorado, Idaho, Nevada, Washington, and British Columbia, Canada. Providing exceptional experiences to every Customer is what we do each and every day. And, this philosophy extends to how we treat our Team Members too. Moneytree is committed to supporting its Team and a work culture that is positive, inclusive and professional.

A day in the life of a Moneytree Data Scientist

You Will Be Responsible For

The Moneytree Data Scientist reports to the Chief Risk & Analytics Officer and works with a small autonomous team responsible for creating predictive product and business models, analyzing and summarizing data, and implementing and optimizing models.

Managing projects that deliver business value efficiently
Collaborating to frame the business problem
Understanding, collecting, and transforming data
Constructing models and assessing their quality with appropriate monitoring
Designing experiments and analyzing their results
Communicating results and recommendations to others
Identifying opportunities to apply statistics to improve business performance
Adhering to Company Policies and Procedures

Competencies

Creating predictive models using linear regression, logistic regression and other advanced statistical/machine-learning techniques
Implementing models and ensuring their accuracy
Analyzing and summarizing data to make recommendations
Communicating clearly and concisely to individuals from diverse backgrounds
Influencing others both verbally and in writing
Managing projects to timely completion
Displaying a high degree of emotional intelligence; is accountable and responsive; exercises good judgment in a variety of situations
Possessing strong organizational and time management skills
Ability to manage a large workload and produce high-quality work efficiently from home
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.)
Willingness to learn and adapt to new responsibilities
Works well both independently and as part of a team
An entrepreneurial spirit

Requirements

Master’s degree in statistics or a similar quantitative field of study, such as mathematics, economics, physics, or industrial engineering
Working knowledge of R, Python, SAS or similar statistical programming package
Working knowledge of SQL
1+ years of experience in statistical modeling
Residence in CO, FL, IA, ID, NM, NV, OK, OR, TX, VA, or WA

What We Have To Offer

Pay range: $115,000-$130,000 per year, depending on experience
A true career with growth and promotion opportunities
Competitive compensation including holiday paid time, paid vacation, paid sick leave
Low-cost medical, dental, and vision insurance
Paid training and career growth opportunities
Tuition Reimbursement Program
Student Loan Repayment Program
401(k) and Retirement Profit-Sharing Plan
Volunteer Time Benefit
Adoption Assistance Program
Pet Insurance Group Discounts

Are you ready to open the door to a great future? Explore a Moneytree career (moneytreeinc.com/career-opportunities) today to see why we’ve been named one of the Best Places to Work, and check out our unbeatable benefits package (moneytreeinc.com/company/employee-benefits).

We value equal opportunity and workforce diversity.
